YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:4-12

value: GOD did not give any man two hearts in his chest. Nor did He turn your wives whom you estrange (according to your custom) into your mothers.* Nor did He turn your adopted children into genetic offspring. All these are mere utterances that you have invented. GOD speaks the truth, and He guides in the (right) path.

You shall give your adopted children names that preserve their relationship to their genetic parents. This is more equitable in the sight of GOD. If you do not know their parents, then, as your brethren in religion, you shall treat them as members of your family. You do not commit a sin if you make a mistake in this respect; you are responsible for your purposeful intentions. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Evlatlıklarınıza, onların genetik ebeveynleriyle bağlantılarını koruyan isimler verin. Bu, TANRI nazarında daha adildir. Eğer onların ebeveynlerini tanımıyorsanız, o zaman din kardeşleriniz olarak onlara ailenizin fertleri gibi davranın. Bu hususta bir hata yaparsanız bir günah işlemiş olmazsınız; sizler kasıtlı olan niyetlerinizden sorumlusunuz. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: The prophet is closer to the believers than they are to each other, and his wives are like mothers to them. The relatives ought to take care of one another in accordance with GOD’s scripture. Thus, the believers shall take care of their relatives who immigrate to them, provided they have taken care of their own families first. These are commandments of this scripture.
Recall that we took from the prophets their covenant, including you (O Muhammad), Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn pledge.*
Subsequently, He will surely question the truthful about their truthfulness, and has prepared for the disbelievers (in this Quranic fact) a painful retribution.
O you who believe, remember GOD’s blessing upon you; when soldiers attacked you, we sent upon them violent wind and invisible soldiers. GOD is Seer of everything you do.
When they came from above you, and from beneath you, your eyes were terrified, your hearts ran out of patience, and you harbored unbefitting thoughts about GOD.
That is when the believers were truly tested; they were severely shaken up.
YENİSİ: İşte o zaman inananlar hakikaten test edildi; şiddetle sarsılmışlardı.

value: The hypocrites and those with doubts in their hearts said, “What GOD and His messenger promised us was no more than an illusion!”
Devotion to God Is Indivisible
Do Not Change Your Names
Muhammad Pledges to Support God’s Messenger of the Covenant*
The Battle of the Parties
*33:4 It was a custom in Arabia to estrange the wife by declaring that she was like the husband’s mother. Such an unfair practice is abrogated herein.
YENİSİ: *33:4 Arabistan’da, eşin, kocanın annesi gibi olduğu beyan edilerek yabancılaştırılması bir gelenekti. Burada, böylesi adil olmayan bir uygulama iptal edilmiştir.

value: *33:7 The covenant is detailed in 3:81. God took a covenant from the prophets that they shall support His Messenger of the Covenant who would come after Muhammad to purify and unify their messages. The Covenant was made before the earth’s creation, and was fulfilled in Mecca Zul-Hijja 3, 1391 (Dec. 21, 1971). The sum of the Islamic month (12), plus the day (3), plus the year (1391) gives 1406, 19x74 Overwhelming proof identifying God’s Messenger of the Covenant as Rashad Khalifa is provided throughout the Quran (Appendices 2 & 26).
The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:13-25
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:13-25

value: A group of them said, “O people of Yathrib, you cannot attain victory; go back.” Others made up excuses to the prophet: “Our homes are vulnerable,” when they were not vulnerable. They just wanted to flee.
YENİSİ: Onlardan bir grup dedi ki: “Ey Yesrib halkı, galibiyet elde edemezsiniz; geri dönün.” Diğerleri peygambere bahaneler uydurdular: “Evlerimiz savunmasızdır,” oysa savunmasız değillerdi. Onlar sadece kaçmak istiyorlardı.

value: Had the enemy invaded and asked them to join, they would have joined the enemy without hesitation.
They had pledged to GOD in the past that they would not turn around and flee; making a pledge with GOD involves a great responsibility.
Say, “If you flee, you can never flee from death or from being killed. No matter what happens, you only live a short while longer.”
Say, “Who would protect you from GOD if He willed any adversity, or willed any blessing for you?” They can never find, beside GOD, any other Lord and Master.
GOD is fully aware of the hinderers among you, and those who say to their comrades, “Let us all stay behind.” Rarely do they mobilize for defense.

Also, they are too stingy when dealing with you. If anything threatens the community, you see their eyes rolling with fear, as if death had already come to them. Once the crisis is over, they whip you with sharp tongues. They are too stingy with their wealth. These are not believers, and, consequently, GOD has nullified their works. This is easy for GOD to do.

They thought that the parties might come back. In that case, they would wish that they were lost in the desert, asking about your news from afar. Had the parties attacked you while they were with you, they would rarely support you.
The messenger of GOD has set up a good example for those among you who seek GOD and the Last Day, and constantly think about GOD.
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın elçisi, içinizde TANRI’yı ve Son Gün’ü arayan ve sürekli olarak TANRI’yı düşünen kimseler için iyi bir örnek teşkil etmiştir.

value: When the true believers saw the parties (ready to attack), they said, “This is what GOD and His messenger have promised us, and GOD and His messenger are truthful.” This (dangerous situation) only strengthened their faith and augmented their submission.
Among the believers there are people who fulfill their pledges with GOD. Some of them died, while others stand ready, never wavering.
GOD will surely recompense the truthful for their truthfulness, and will punish the hypocrites, if He so wills, or redeem them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: TANRI, doğru sözlüleri, doğru sözlülüklerinden ötürü mutlaka ödüllendirecektir; ikiyüzlüleri ise eğer O öyle irade ederse, cezalandıracaktır ya da onları kurtaracaktır. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: GOD repulsed those who disbelieved with their rage, and they left empty-handed. GOD thus spared the believers any fighting. GOD is Powerful, Almighty.
YENİSİ: TANRI inkâr etmiş olanları hiddetleriyle birlikte geri püskürttü ve onlar elleri boş kaldılar. TANRI böylece herhangi bir savaştan inananları esirgedi. TANRI Güçlüdür, Kudretlidir.

value: The Prophet’s Courage*
During Muhammad’s Time

*33:21 Satan took this verse out of context, and relied on the people’s idolization of the prophet Muhammad to innovate a whole set of unauthorized and unreasonable regulations called “Sunna of the Prophet.” This created a totally different religion (see 42:21 and Appendix 18).
YENİSİ: *33:21 Şeytan bu ayeti bağlamından kopardı ve insanların Muhammed peygamberi putlaştırmasına dayandırarak “Peygamberin Sünneti” diye adlandırılan bir dizi yetkisiz ve mantıksız düzenlemeler icat etti. Bu da tamamen farklı bir din yarattı (42:21 ve Ek 18’e bakınız).

value: The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:26-36
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:26-36

value: He also brought down their allies among the people of the scripture from their secure positions, and threw terror into their hearts. Some of them you killed, and some you took captive.
He made you inherit their land, their homes, their money, and lands you had never stepped on. GOD is in full control of all things.
O prophet, say to your wives, “If you are seeking this life and its vanities, then let me compensate you and allow you to go amicably.
YENİSİ: Ey peygamber, eşlerine de ki: “Eğer bu hayatı ve onun gösterişlerini arıyorsanız, o zaman sizi tazmin edeyim ve dostça gitmenize izin vereyim.

value: “But if you are seeking GOD and His messenger, and the abode of the Hereafter, then GOD has prepared for the righteous among you a great recompense.”
O wives of the prophet, if any of you commits a gross sin, the retribution will be doubled for her. This is easy for GOD to do.
Any one of you who obeys GOD and His messenger, and leads a righteous life, we will grant her double the recompense, and we have prepared for her a generous provision.

O wives of the prophet, you are not the same as any other women, if you observe righteousness. (You have a greater responsibility.) Therefore, you shall not speak too softly, lest those with disease in their hearts may get the wrong ideas; you shall speak only righteousness.
YENİSİ: Ey peygamber eşleri, eğer doğruluğu gözetirseniz, siz diğer kadınlar ile aynı değilsiniz. (Sizin daha büyük bir sorumluluğunuz var.) Öyleyse kalplerinde hastalık olanlar yanlış fikirlere kapılabilirler diye çok yumuşak bir şekilde konuşmayın; yalnızca doğruluğu dile getirin.

value: You shall settle down in your homes, and do not mingle with the people excessively, like you used to do in the old days of ignorance. You shall observe the Contact Prayers (Salat), and give the obligatory charity (Zakat), and obey GOD and His messenger. GOD wishes to remove all unholiness from you, O you who live around the Sacred Shrine, and to purify you completely.
YENİSİ: Evlerinizde yerleşin ve cahiliyenin o eski günlerinde vaktiyle yaptığınız gibi halkla çok fazla haşir neşir olmayın. İletişim Dualarını (Namazı) gözetin, zorunlu bağışı (Zekâtı) verin ve TANRI’ya ve elçisine itaat edin. Ey Kutsal Mabedin etrafında yaşayanlar, TANRI sizden tüm kirlilikleri gidermek ve sizleri tamamen arındırmak istiyor.

value: Remember what is being recited in your homes of GOD’s revelations and the wisdom inherent therein. GOD is Sublime, Cognizant.
YENİSİ: Evlerinizde TANRI’nın vahiylerinden ve onda içkin olan bilgelikten okunmakta olanı hatırlayın. TANRI Haşmetlidir, Haberdardır.

value: The submitting men, the submitting women, the believing men, the believing women, the obedient men, the obedient women, the truthful men, the truthful women, the steadfast men, the steadfast women, the reverent men, the reverent women, the charitable men, the charitable women, the fasting men, the fasting women, the chaste men, the chaste women, and the men who commemorate GOD frequently, and the commemorating women; GOD has prepared for them forgiveness and a great recompense.
YENİSİ: Teslim olan erkekler, teslim olan kadınlar, inanan erkekler, inanan kadınlar, itaatkâr erkekler, itaatkâr kadınlar, doğru sözlü erkekler, doğru sözlü kadınlar, kararlı erkekler, kararlı kadınlar, derin saygı duyan erkekler, derin saygı duyan kadınlar, bağış yapan erkekler, bağış yapan kadınlar, oruç tutan erkekler, oruç tutan kadınlar, iffetli erkekler, iffetli kadınlar ve TANRI’yı sıkça anan erkekler ve sıkça anan kadınlar; TANRI onlar için bağışlanma ve büyük bir mükafat hazırlamıştır.

value: No believing man or believing woman, if GOD and His messenger issue any command, has any choice regarding that command. Anyone who disobeys GOD and His messenger has gone far astray.
YENİSİ: Eğer TANRI ve elçisi herhangi bir emir verirse, hiçbir inanan erkek veya inanan kadın o emre ilişkin herhangi bir seçim hakkına sahip değildir. Kim TANRI’ya ve elçisine itaatsizlik ederse, büsbütün sapmıştır.

value: Special Responsibility For Being Close

by Muhammad

Muhammad the Man Disobeys
Muhammad the Messenger
YENİSİ: Muhammed Tarafından İşlenen Büyük Hata\nİnsan Muhammed, Elçi Muhammed’e İtaatsizlik Ediyor

value: The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:37-49
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:37-49

value: Recall that you said to the one who was blessed by GOD, and blessed by you, “Keep your wife and reverence GOD,” and you hid inside yourself what GOD wished to proclaim. Thus, you feared the people, when you were supposed to fear only GOD. When Zeid was completely through with his wife, we had you marry her, in order to establish the precedent that a man can marry the divorced wife of his adopted son. GOD’s commands shall be done.
YENİSİ: Hani hem TANRI tarafından hem de senin tarafından nimetlendirilmiş olan kişiye demiştin ki: “Eşini tut ve TANRI’ya derin saygı duy” ve TANRI’nın ilan etmek istediği şeyi sen kendi içinde saklamıştın. Böylece sadece TANRI’dan çekinmen gerekirken sen insanlardan çekindin. Zeyd eşinden tamamen ayrıldığında, bir adamın evlatlığının boşanmış hanımıyla evlenebilecek olmasına emsal teşkil etmesi için, biz seni onunla evlendirdik. TANRI’nın emirleri yerine getirilecektir.

value: The prophet is not committing an error by doing anything that is made lawful by GOD. Such is GOD’s system since the early generations. GOD’s command is a sacred duty.
Those who deliver GOD’s messages, and who reverence Him alone, shall never fear anyone but GOD. GOD is the most efficient reckoner.
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın mesajlarını iletenler ve yalnızca O’na derin saygı duyanlar, TANRI'dan başka kimseden hiçbir zaman korkmamalılar. TANRI en etkin hesap görendir.

value: Muhammad was not the father of any man among you. He was a messenger of GOD and the final prophet. GOD is fully aware of all things.
O you who believe, you shall remember GOD frequently.*
You shall glorify Him day and night.
He is the One who helps you, together with His angels, to lead you out of darkness into the light. He is Most Merciful towards the believers.
Their greeting the day they meet Him is, “Peace,” and He has prepared for them a generous recompense.
O prophet, we have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news, as well as a warner.
YENİSİ: Ey peygamber, biz seni bir şahit, bir müjdeleyici, aynı zamanda bir uyarıcı olarak gönderdik.

value: Inviting to GOD, in accordance with His will, and a guiding beacon.
YENİSİ: O’nun iradesine uygun olarak TANRI’ya davet eden ve yol gösteren bir işaret ışığı.

value: Deliver good news to the believers, that they have deserved from GOD a great blessing.
Do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites, disregard their insults, and put your trust in GOD; GOD suffices as an advocate.
YENİSİ: İnkârcılara ve ikiyüzlülere itaat etme, onların hakaretlerini görmezden gel ve TANRI’ya güvenip dayan; bir savunucu olarak TANRI yeter.

value: O you who believe, if you married believing women, then divorced them before having intercourse with them, they do not owe you any waiting interim (before marrying another man). You shall compensate them equitably, and let them go amicably.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, eğer inanan kadınlarla evlendiyseniz, sonra onlarla cinsi münasebette bulunmadan önce onları boşadıysanız, onların size (başka bir adamla evlenmeden önce) herhangi bir bekleme süresi borcu yoktur. Onları adil bir şekilde tazmin edin ve onların dostça gitmelerine izin verin.

value: Not The Final\nMessenger*
Marriage Laws

*33:40 Despite this clear definition of Muhammad, most Muslims insist that he was the last prophet and also the last messenger. This is a tragic human trait as we see in 40:34. Those who readily believe God realize that God sends His purifying and consolidating Messenger of the Covenant after the final prophet Muhammad (3:81, 33:7).
*33:41-42 Your god is whatever occupies your thoughts most of the time. Hence the commandment to commemorate God and glorify Him day and night. See Appendix 27.
The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:50-55
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:50-55

value: O prophet, we made lawful for you your wives to whom you have paid their due dowry, or what you already have, as granted to you by GOD. Also lawful for you in marriage are the daughters of your father’s brothers, the daughters of your father’s sisters, the daughters of your mother’s brothers, the daughters of your mother’s sisters, who have emigrated with you. Also, if a believing woman gave herself to the prophet—by forfeiting the dowry—the prophet may marry her without a dowry, if he so wishes. However, her forfeiting of the dowry applies only to the prophet, and not to the other believers. We have already decreed their rights in regard to their spouses or what they already have. This is to spare you any embarrassment. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

You may gently shun any one of them, and you may bring closer to you any one of them. If you reconcile with any one you had estranged, you commit no error. In this way, they will be pleased, will have no grief, and will be content with what you equitably offer to all of them. GOD knows what is in your hearts. GOD is Omniscient, Clement.
YENİSİ: Onlardan herhangi birini nazikçe uzak tutabilirsin ve onlardan herhangi birini kendine daha yakın tutabilirsin. Uzaklaştırmış olduğun herhangi biriyle uzlaşırsan hiçbir hata işlemiş olmazsın. Bu sayede onlar hoşnut olacaklar, üzülmeyecekler ve hepsine adil bir şekilde verdiğinle razı olacaklardır. TANRI kalplerinizde olanı bilir. TANRI Her Şeyi Bilendir, Hoşgörülüdür.

value: Beyond the categories described to you, you are enjoined from marrying any other women, nor can you substitute a new wife (from the prohibited categories), no matter how much you admire their beauty. You must be content with those already made lawful to you. GOD is watchful over all things.

O you who believe, do not enter the prophet’s homes unless you are given permission to eat, nor shall you force such an invitation in any manner. If you are invited, you may enter. When you finish eating, you shall leave; do not engage him in lengthy conversations. This used to hurt the prophet, and he was too shy to tell you. But GOD does not shy away from the truth. If you have to ask his wives for something, ask them from behind a barrier. This is purer for your hearts and their hearts. You are not to hurt the messenger of GOD. You shall not marry his wives after him, for this would be a gross offense in the sight of GOD.*
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, yemek yemeniz amacıyla size izin verilmedikçe, peygamberin evlerine girmeyin; böylesi bir daveti de hiçbir şekilde zorlamayın. Eğer davet edilirseniz, girebilirsiniz. Yemeği bitirdiğiniz zaman oradan ayrılın; onu uzun sohbetlerle meşgul etmeyin. Bu, vaktiyle peygamberi incitiyordu ve o size söyleyemeyecek kadar çekingendi. Fakat TANRI hakikatten çekinmez. Eğer onun eşlerinden bir şey istemeniz gerekirse, bir bariyerin arkasından isteyin. Bu, sizin kalpleriniz ve onların kalpleri için daha temizdir. TANRI’nın elçisini incitmeyeceksiniz. Ondan sonra onun eşleriyle evlenmeyin, zira bu, TANRI katında ağır bir suç olur.*

value: Whether you declare anything, or hide it, GOD is fully aware of all things.
YENİSİ: Herhangi bir şeyi ister beyan edin ister onu saklayın, TANRI her şeyin tamamen farkındadır.

value: The women may relax (their dress code) around their fathers, their sons, their brothers, the sons of their brothers, the sons of their sisters, the other women, and their (female) servants. They shall reverence GOD. GOD witnesses all things.
Etiquette

*33:53 We are enjoined in 4:22 from marrying women who were previously married to our fathers. Nor can the father marry the divorced wife of his son (4:23). This divine commandment preserves our respect for our fathers and their most private affairs. Similarly, the prophet was a father figure to the believers of his time. For the good of those believers, God enjoined them from marrying women who were previously married to the prophet. Marriage is a sacred and very private relationship, and the prophet’s private life was better kept private.
YENİSİ: *33:53 Babalarımızla daha önce evli olan kadınlarla evlenmekten 4:22’de men edilmekteyiz. Baba da oğlunun boşanmış hanımıyla evlenemez (4:23). Bu göksel buyruk, babalarımıza ve onların en mahrem meselelerine duyduğumuz saygıyı muhafaza eder. Benzer şekilde, peygamber, dönemindeki inananlara bir baba figürüydü. Bu inananların iyiliği için, Tanrı onları, peygamberle daha önce evli olan kadınlarla evlenmekten menetti. Evlilik kutsal ve çok özel bir ilişkidir ve peygamberin özel hayatının mahrem tutulması gerekiyordu.

value: The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:56-70
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:56-70

value: GOD and His angels help and support the prophet. O you who believe, you shall help and support him, and regard him as he should be regarded.*
Surely, those who oppose GOD and His messenger, GOD afflicts them with a curse in this life, and in the Hereafter; He has prepared for them a shameful retribution.
YENİSİ: Şüphesiz, TANRI’ya ve elçisine muhalefet edenler, TANRI bu hayatta ve Ahirette onlara bir lanetle ızdırap verir; O, onlar için utanç verici bir azap hazırlamıştır.

value: Those who persecute the believing men and the believing women, who did not do anything wrong, have committed not only a falsehood, but also a gross sin.
YENİSİ: Hiçbir haksızlık yapmamış olan inanan erkeklere ve inanan kadınlara zulmedenler, sadece yalan söylemekle kalmadılar, aynı zamanda da büyük bir günah da işlediler.

value: O prophet, tell your wives, your daughters, and the wives of the believers that they shall lengthen their garments. Thus, they will be recognized (as righteous women) and avoid being insulted. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

Unless the hypocrites, and those with disease in their hearts, and the vicious liars of the city refrain (from persecuting you), we will surely grant you the upper hand, then they will be forced to leave within a short while.
YENİSİ: İkiyüzlüler, kalplerinde hastalık bulunanlar ve şehrin azılı yalancıları (size zulmetmekten) vazgeçmezlerse, biz mutlaka sana üstünlük bahşederiz, sonrasında onlar kısa bir süre içinde ayrılmaya zorlanacaklardır.

value: They have incurred condemnation wherever they go; (unless they stop attacking you,) they may be taken and killed.
This is GOD’s eternal system, and you will find that GOD’s system is unchangeable.
The people ask you about the Hour (end of the world). Say, “The knowledge thereof is only with GOD. For all that you know, the Hour may be close.”
GOD has condemned the disbelievers, and has prepared for them Hell.
Eternally they abide therein. They will find no lord, nor a supporter.
The day they are thrown into Hell, they will say, “Oh, we wish we obeyed GOD, and obeyed the messenger.”
They will also say, “Our Lord, we have obeyed our masters and leaders, but they led us astray.
“Our Lord, give them double the retribution, and curse them a tremendous curse.”
O you who believe, do not be like those who hurt Moses, then GOD absolved him of what they said. He was, in the sight of GOD, honorable.
O you who believe, reverence GOD and utter only the correct utterances.
During the Prophet’s Life*
Dress Code\nfor Women
End of the World Revealed*
The Followers\nTurn On Their Leaders

*33:56 The word “prophet” (Nabi) consistently refers to Muhammad only when he was alive. Satan used this verse to entice the Muslims into commemorating Muhammad, constantly, instead of commemorating God as enjoined in 33:41-42.
YENİSİ: *33:56 “Peygamber” (Nebi) kelimesi tutarlı bir şekilde Muhammed’i yalnızca hayattayken ifade eder. Şeytan, Müslümanları 33:41-42 de emredildiği üzere Tanrı’yı anmak yerine Muhammed’i sürekli olarak anmaya ayartmak için bu ayeti kullandı.

value: *33:63 Less than a century ago, only God possessed knowledge about television and space satellites, for example. He revealed this knowledge at the predetermined time. Similarly, God has revealed the time appointed for the end of this world (Appendix 25).
The Parties (Al-Ahzãb) 33:71-73 & Sheba (Saba’) 34:1-9
YENİSİ: Taraflar (El-Ahzâb) 33:71-73 & Saba (Saba’) 34:1-9

value: He will then fix your works, and forgive your sins. Those who obey GOD and His messenger have triumphed a great triumph.

We have offered the responsibility (freedom of choice) to the heavens and the earth, and the mountains, but they refused to bear it, and were afraid of it. But the human being accepted it; he was transgressing, ignorant.*
YENİSİ: Biz sorumluluğu (seçim özgürlüğünü) göklere, yeryüzüne ve dağlara sunduk, ancak onlar onu yüklenmeyi reddettiler ve ondan korktular. Fakat insanoğlu onu kabul etti; o, haddi aşandı, cahildi.*

value: For GOD will inevitably punish the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women, and the idol worshiping men and the idol worshiping women. GOD redeems the believing men and the believing women. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Zira TANRI ikiyüzlü erkekleri ve ikiyüzlü kadınları, puta tapan erkekleri ve puta tapan kadınları kaçınılmaz şekilde cezalandıracaktır. TANRI, inanan erkekleri ve inanan kadınları kurtarır. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: Freedom of Choice
YENİSİ: Seçim Özgürlüğü

value: Praise be to GOD—to whom belongs everything in the heavens and the earth; all praise is also due to Him in the Hereafter. He is the Most Wise, the Cognizant.

He knows everything that goes into the earth, and everything that comes out of it, and everything that comes down from the sky, and everything that climbs into it. He is the Most Merciful, the Forgiving.

Those who disbelieve have said, “The Hour will never come to pass!” Say, “Absolutely—by my Lord—it will most certainly come to you. He is the Knower of the future. Not even the equivalent of an atom’s weight is hidden from Him, be it in the heavens or the earth. Not even smaller than that, or larger (is hidden). All are in a profound record.”
Most certainly, He will reward those who believe and lead a righteous life. These have deserved forgiveness and a generous provision.
As for those who constantly challenge our revelations, they have incurred a retribution of painful humiliation.
YENİSİ: Vahiylerimize sürekli olarak meydan okuyanlara gelince, onlar acı veren aşağılanmanın azabını üzerlerine çekmişlerdir.

value: It is evident to those who are blessed with knowledge that this revelation from your Lord to you is the truth, and that it guides to the path of the Almighty, the Most Praiseworthy.
YENİSİ: Bilgi ile nimetlendirilenler için gün gibi ortadadır ki, Rabbinden sana gelen bu vahiy hakikattir ve Kudretli Olan’ın, Övgüye En Layık Olan’ın yoluna yönlendirir.

value: Those who disbelieve have said, “Let us show you a man who tells you that after you are torn apart you will be created anew.
“Either he fabricated lies about GOD, or he is crazy.” Indeed, those who disbelieve in the Hereafter have incurred the worst retribution; they have gone far astray.

Have they not seen all the things in front of them and behind them, in the heaven and the earth? If we willed, we could have caused the earth to swallow them, or caused masses to fall on them from the sky. This should be a sufficient proof for every obedient servant.

In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Sure 34: Saba
(Saba’)
En Lütufkâr ve En Merhametli Olan Tanrı’nın adıyla.

value: *33:72 The animals, trees, stars, etc. took advantage of this most gracious offer. See Appendix 7.
Sheba (Saba’) 34:10-21
YENİSİ: Saba (Saba’) 34:10-21

value: We endowed David with blessings from us: “O mountains, submit with him, and you too, O birds.” We softened the iron for him.
“You may make shields that fit perfectly, and work righteousness. Whatever you do, I am Seer thereof.”
YENİSİ: “Kalıp gibi oturan zırhlar üretebilir ve doğruluğa çalışabilirsin. Ne yaparsan yap, Ben onu Görenim.”

value: To Solomon we committed the wind at his disposal, traveling one month coming and one month going. And we caused a spring of oil to gush out for him. Also, the jinns worked for him, by his Lord’s leave. Any one of them who disregarded our commands, we subjected him to a severe retribution.
YENİSİ: Süleyman’a, gelişi bir ay süren ve gidişi bir ay süren rüzgârı emrine bıraktık. Ve bir petrol kaynağının onun için fışkırmasına yol açtık. Ayrıca, cinler de Rabbinin izniyle onun için çalıştılar. Onlardan her kim bizim emirlerimizi göz ardı ettiyse, onu şiddetli bir azaba maruz bıraktık.

value: They made for him anything he wanted—niches, statues, deep pools, and heavy cooking pots. O family of David, work (righteousness) to show your appreciation. Only a few of My servants are appreciative.

When the appointed time for his death came, they had no clue that he had died. It was not until one of the animals tried to eat his staff, and he fell down, that the jinns realized that he was dead. They thus realized that if they really knew the unseen, they would have stopped working so hard as soon as he died.
YENİSİ: Ölümü için tayin edilmiş vakit geldiğinde, onun ölmüş olduğuna dair onların hiçbir ipucu yoktu. Cinler onun ölü olduğunun, hayvanlardan biri onun asasını yemeye çalışıp da o yere düşünceye kadar farkına varmadılar. Onlar böylece fark ettiler ki, eğer görülmeyeni gerçekten bilselerdi, o ölür ölmez bu kadar sıkı çalışmayı durdurmuş olurlardı.

value: Sheba’s homeland used to be a marvel, with two gardens on the right and the left. Eat from your Lord’s provisions, and be appreciative of Him—good land, and a forgiving Lord.
YENİSİ: Vaktiyle Saba’nın anavatanı sağda ve solda iki bahçesiyle birlikte bir harikaydı. Rabbinizin rızıklarından yiyin, ve O’na minnettar olun—güzel ülke, ve bağışlayan bir Rab.

value: They turned away and, consequently, we poured upon them a disastrous flood, and we substituted their two gardens into two gardens of bad tasting fruits, thorny plants, and a skimpy harvest.
YENİSİ: Onlar yüz çevirdiler ve sonuç olarak, onların üzerine felaket getiren bir sel boşalttık, ve onların iki bahçesini kötü tat veren meyvelerin, dikenli bitkilerin ve kıt bir hasadın olduğu iki bahçeyle değiştirdik.

value: We thus requited them for their disbelief. Do we not requite only the disbelievers?
YENİSİ: Biz böylece inkârları yüzünden onlara karşılık verdik. Biz sadece inkârcılara karşılık vermiyor muyuz?

value: We placed between them and the communities that we blessed other oases, and we secured the journey between them: “Travel therein days and nights in complete security.”
YENİSİ: Biz onlar ile bereketlendirdiğimiz toplulukların arasına başka vahalar yerleştirdik, ve onların arasındaki yolculuğu güvence altına aldık: “Orada günler ve geceler boyunca tam bir güvenlik içinde yolculuk edin.”

value: But they (turned unappreciative and) challenged: “Our Lord, we do not care if You increase the distance of our journeys (without any stations).” They thus wronged their own souls. Consequently, we made them history, and scattered them into small communities throughout the land. This should provide lessons for those who are steadfast, appreciative.
YENİSİ: Fakat onlar (nankörleştiler ve) meydan okudular: “Rabbimiz, (herhangi bir istasyon olmaksızın) yolculuklarımızın mesafesini artırman umurumuzda değil.” Böylece kendi nefislerine haksızlık ettiler. Sonuç olarak, onları tarihe karıştırdık ve onları ülke boyunca küçük topluluklara dağıttık. Bu, kararlı ve minnettar olanlar için dersler sağlamalıdır.

value: Satan found them readily fulfilling his expectations. They followed him, except a few believers.
YENİSİ: Şeytan onları, onun beklentilerini kolayca yerine getirirken buldu. Birkaç inanan hariç, onu takip ettiler.

value: He never had any power over them. But we thus distinguish those who believe in the Hereafter from those who are doubtful about it.* Your Lord is in full control of all things.
YENİSİ: Onların üzerinde hiçbir zaman herhangi bir gücü olmadı. Fakat biz, Ahirete inananları, onun hakkında şüphe duyanlardan bu şekilde ayırırız.* Senin Rabbin her şeyde tam kontrol durumundadır.

value: David and Solomon
YENİSİ: Davut ve Süleyman

value: The First Oil Field
YENİSİ: İlk Petrol Sahası

value: Jinns’ Knowledge is Limited
YENİSİ: Cinlerin Bilgisi Sınırlıdır

value: Satan Claims the Majority
YENİSİ: Şeytan Çoğunluğu İster

value: The Objective: \nDo We Believe \nin the Hereafter?*
YENİSİ: Amaç:\nAhirete\nİnanıyor Muyuz?*

value: *34:21 The criteria that inform us whether we believe in the Hereafter or not are in 6:113, 17:45, & 39:45. These three criteria bring out our true convictions, regardless of our oral statements.
YENİSİ: *34:21 Ahirete inanıp inanmadığımızı bize bildiren kriterler 6:113, 17:45, & 39:45’te yer alır. Bu üç kriter, sözlü ifadelerimizden bağımsız olarak, bizim hakiki kanaatlerimizi ortaya çıkarır.

value: Sheba (Saba’) 34:22-34
YENİSİ: Saba (Saba’) 34:22-34

value: Say, “Implore the idols you have set up beside GOD. They do not possess as much as a single atom in the heavens, or the earth. They possess no partnership therein, nor does He permit them to be His assistants.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Yalvarın TANRI’nın yanında edindiğiniz o putlara. Onlar, göklerde veya yeryüzünde tek bir atom kadar bile bir şeye sahip değiller. Oralarda hiçbir ortaklıkları yoktur, O onların, O’nun yardımcıları olmalarına izin de vermez.”

value: Intercession with Him will be in vain, unless it coincides with His will. When their minds are finally settled down, and they ask, “What did your Lord say,” they will say, “The truth.” He is the Most High, the Most Great.
YENİSİ: O’nun iradesiyle örtüşmedikçe O’nun katında şefaat boşuna olacaktır. Zihinleri nihayet yatıştığında ve onlar “Rabbiniz ne dedi” diye sorunca onlar, “Hakikati” diyecekler. O, Yüceler Yücesidir, En Büyük Olandır.

value: Say, “Who provides for you, from the heavens and the earth?” Say, “GOD,” and “Either we or you are guided, or have gone far astray.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Göklerden ve yeryüzünden size kim rızık sağlıyor?” De ki: “TANRI,” ve “Ya biz ya da siz rehberlik edilmiştir ya da çok uzak sapmıştır.”

value: Say, “You are not responsible for our crimes, nor are we responsible for what you do.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Siz bizim suçlarımızdan sorumlu değilsiniz, biz de sizin yaptıklarınızdan sorumlu değiliz.”

value: Say, “Our Lord will gather us all together before Him, then He will judge between us equitably. He is the Judge, the Omniscient.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Rabbimiz hepimizi huzurunda bir araya getirecektir, sonra O aramızda adil bir şekilde yargılama yapacaktır. O, Yargıçtır, Her Şeyi Bilendir.”

value: Say, “Show me the idols you have set up as partners with Him!” Say, “No; He is the one GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “O’na ortaklar olarak edindiğiniz o putları gösterin bana!” De ki: “Hayır; O tek TANRI’dır, Kudretli, En Bilge Olan.”

value: We have sent you (O Rashad)* to all the people, a bearer of good news, as well as a warner, but most people do not know.
YENİSİ: Biz seni (Ey Reşad)* bir müjdeleyici ve aynı zamanda bir uyarıcı olarak bütün insanlara gönderdik, fakat insanların çoğu bilmez.

value: They challenge, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
YENİSİ: “Eğer doğru sözlü iseniz bu vaat ne zaman gerçekleşecek?” diye meydan okurlar.

value: Say, “You have a specific time, on a specific day, that you cannot delay by one hour, nor advance.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Spesifik bir günde spesifik bir vaktiniz vardır ki, onu ne bir saat erteleyebilirsiniz, ne de öne alabilirsiniz.”

value: Those who disbelieve have said, “We will not believe in this Quran, nor in the previous scriptures.” If you could only envision these transgressors when they stand before their Lord! They will argue with one another back and forth. The followers will tell their leaders, “If it were not for you, we would have been believers.”
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler demişlerdi ki: “Biz ne bu Kuran’a ne de önceki kutsal yazılara inanacağız.” Bu haddi aşanları Rablerinin huzurunda dururken bir tasavvur edebilseydin! Birbirleriyle ileri geri tartışacaklar. Takipçiler liderlerine diyecekler ki: “Eğer siz olmasaydınız biz inananlar olurduk.”

value: The leaders will say to those who followed them, “Are we the ones who diverted you from the guidance after it came to you? No; it is you who were wicked.”
YENİSİ: Liderler kendilerini takip edenlere diyecekler ki: “Kılavuz size geldikten sonra, sizi ondan çeviren biz miydik? Hayır; asıl kötü olanlar sizlerdiniz.”

value: The followers will say to their leaders, “It was you who schemed night and day, then commanded us to be unappreciative of GOD, and to set up idols to rank with Him.” They will be ridden with remorse, when they see the retribution, for we will place shackles around the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they not justly requited for what they did?
YENİSİ: Takipçileri de liderlerine şöyle diyecekler, “Gece gündüz plan kuran, sonra da TANRI’ya karşı nankör olmamızı ve O’na denk tutmak için putlar edinmemizi emreden sizlerdiniz.” Azabı gördüklerinde pişmanlıkla dolu olacaklar, çünkü biz bu inkâr etmiş olanların boyunlarına prangalar vuracağız. Yaptıklarının karşılığını adil bir şekilde almıyorlar mı?

value: Every time we sent a warner to a community, the leaders of that community said, “We reject the message you are sent with.”
YENİSİ: Her defasında bir topluluğa bir uyarıcı gönderdiğimizde, o topluluğun liderleri dediler ki: “Sizinle birlikte gönderilen mesajı reddediyoruz.”

value: No Intercession
YENİSİ: Şefaat Yoktur

value: God’s Messenger of the Covenant
YENİSİ: Tanrı’nın Antlaşma Elçisi

value: On the Day of Resurrection
YENİSİ: Diriliş Günü’nde

value: Every Time!
YENİSİ: Her Defasında!

value: *34:28 As detailed in Appendix 2, the name of this messenger is mathematically coded into the Quran as “Rashad Khalifa.” By adding the numerical value of the name “Rashad” (505), plus the numerical value of the name “Khalifa” (725), plus the number of the sura (34), plus the number of the verse (28), we obtain a total that conforms with the Quran’s 19-based mathematical miracle, which was unveiled through Rashad Khalifa. (505 + 725 + 34 + 28= 1292 = 19x68). More information is given in 5:19 and its footnote.
YENİSİ: *34:28 Ek 2’de ayrıntılandırıldığı gibi, bu elçinin adı Kuran’a matematiksel olarak “Reşad Halife” olarak kodlanmıştır. “Reşad” adının sayısal değerini (505), artı “Halife” adının sayısal değerini (725), artı surenin numarasını (34), artı ayetin numarasını (28) ekleyerek, Reşad Halife aracılığıyla ortaya çıkarılmış olan Kuran’ın 19-tabanlı matematiksel mucizesiyle uyumlu olan bir toplam elde ederiz. (505 + 725 + 34 + 28 = 1292 = 19x68). Daha fazla bilgi 5:19’da ve onun dipnotunda verilmiştir.

value: Sheba (Saba’) 34:35-46

value: They also said, “We are more powerful, with more money and children, and we will not be punished.”
Say, “My Lord is the One who controls all provisions; He grants the provisions to whomever He wills, or reduces them, but most people do not know.”

It is not your money or your children that bring you closer to us. Only those who believe and lead a righteous life will receive the reward for their works, multiplied manifold. In the abode of Paradise they will live in perfect peace.
As for those who consistently challenge our revelations, they will abide in retribution.

Say, “My Lord is the One who controls all provisions; He increases the provisions for whomever He chooses from among His servants, or reduces them. Anything you spend (in the cause of God), He will reward you for it; He is the Best Provider.”
On the day when He summons them all, He will say to the angels, “Did these people worship you?”
YENİSİ: Onların hepsini topladığı gün meleklere diyecek ki “Bu insanlar size mi taptılar?”

value: They will answer, “Be You glorified. You are our Lord and Master, not them. Instead, they were worshiping the jinns; most of them were believers therein.”
On that day, you possess no power to help or harm one another, and we will say to the transgressors, “Taste the retribution of the Hell that you used to deny.”

When our proofs were recited to them, perfectly clear, they said, “This is simply a man who wants to divert you from the way your parents are worshiping.” They also said, “These are fabricated lies.” Those who disbelieved also said about the truth that came to them, “This is obviously magic.”
YENİSİ: Kanıtlarımız onlara tamamen apaçık bir şekilde anlatıldığında, “Bu sadece ebeveynlerinizin tapınmakta oldukları yöntemden sizi saptırmak isteyen bir adam” dediler. Ayrıca dediler ki: “Bunlar uydurulmuş yalanlardır.” İnkâr etmiş olanlar, onlara gelen hakikat hakkında da şunu söylediler: “Bu besbelli ki sihir.”

value: We did not give them any other books to study, nor did we send to them before you another warner.
Those before them disbelieved, and even though they did not see onetenth* of (the miracle) we have given to this generation, when they disbelieved My messengers, how severe was My retribution!

Say, “I ask you to do one thing: Devote yourselves to GOD, in pairs or as individuals, then reflect. Your friend (Rashad) is not crazy. He is a manifest warner to you, just before the advent of a terrible retribution.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Sizden tek bir şey yapmanızı istiyorum: Kendinizi TANRI’ya adayın, çiftler halinde ya da bireyler olarak, ardından derinlemesine düşünün. Arkadaşınız (Reşad) deli değildir. O, korkunç bir azabın gelişinden hemen önce size apaçık bir uyarıcıdır.”

value: Mathematical Miracle of the Quran*
God’s Messenger of the Covenant*

*34:45 The great miracles given to Moses and Jesus were limited in time and place; they were witnessed by a few people who happened to exist in that place at that time. But the mathematical miracle of the Quran is perpetual (see 74:30-35 & Appendix 1).
*34:46 By placing the gematrical value of “Rashad” (505) next to the value of “Khalifa” (725), then the sura number (34), and the verse number (46), we get 5057253446= 19x266171234.

YENİSİ: Saba (Saba’) 34:47-54 & Başlatan (Fãtır) 35:1-8

value: Say, “I do not ask you for any wage; you can keep it. My wage comes only from GOD. He witnesses all things.”
Say, “My Lord causes the truth to prevail. He is the Knower of all secrets.”
Say, “The truth has come; while falsehood can neither initiate anything, nor repeat it.”
Say, “If I go astray, I go astray because of my own shortcomings. And if I am guided, it is because of my Lord’s inspiration. He is Hearer, Near.”
If you could only see them when the great terror strikes them; they cannot escape then, and they will be taken away forcibly.
They will then say, “We now believe in it,” but it will be far too late.
They have rejected it in the past; they have decided instead to uphold conjecture and guesswork.*
YENİSİ: Onu geçmişte reddettiler; yerine zan ve tahmine dayanan sonuçlara bağlı kalmaya karar verdiler.*

value: Consequently, they were deprived of everything they longed for. This is the same fate as their counterparts in the previous generations. They harbored too many doubts.

Praise be to GOD, Initiator of the heavens and the earth, and appointer of the angels to be messengers with wings—two, three, and four (wings). He increases the creation as He wills. GOD is Omnipotent.
When GOD showers the people with mercy, no force can stop it. And if He withholds it, no force, other than He, can send it. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
YENİSİ: TANRI insanlara merhamet yağdırdığı zaman, hiçbir güç onu durduramaz. Ve eğer O onu kısıtlarsa, O’ndan başka hiçbir güç onu gönderemez. O Kudretlidir, En Bilge Olandır.

value: O people, remember GOD’s blessings upon you. Is there any creator other than GOD who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no other god beside Him. How could you deviate?
If they disbelieve you, messengers before you have been disbelieved. GOD is in control of all things.
O people, GOD’s promise is the truth; therefore, do not be distracted by this lowly life. Do not be diverted from GOD by mere illusions.
The devil is your enemy, so treat him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be the dwellers of Hell.
Those who disbelieve have incurred a severe retribution, and those who believe and lead a righteous life have deserved forgiveness and a great recompense.

Note the one whose evil work is adorned in his eyes, until he thinks that it is righteous. GOD thus sends astray whoever wills (to go astray), and He guides whoever wills (to be guided). Therefore, do not grieve over them. GOD is fully aware of everything they do.
YENİSİ: Kötü işi, doğru olduğunu sanıncaya kadar gözlerinde süslenen kişiye dikkat et. TANRI böylece,  her (yoldan çıkmak) isteyeni yanlış yola saptırır, her (rehberlik edilmeyi) isteyene de rehberlik eder. Bu yüzden, onlara üzülme. TANRI yaptıkları her şeyin tamamen farkındadır.

value: *34:53 People of all religions tend to forsake the word of God and uphold the words of men. The Jews and the Muslims uphold the Mishnah (Hadith) and Gemarrah (Sunna), while the Christians uphold a trinity invented by the Nicene Conference, 325 years after Jesus.
YENİSİ: *34:53 Bütün dinlerin insanları, Tanrı’nın kelamını terk edip insanların kelamına bağlı kalmaya meyillidirler. Yahudiler ve Müslümanlar Mişna (Hadis) ve Gemara’ya (Sünnet) bağlı kalırlar, Hristiyanlar ise İsa’dan 325 yıl sonra İznik Konferansı tarafından uydurulan bir üçlü birliğe bağlı kalırlar.

value: Initiator (Fãter) 35:9-18
YENİSİ: Başlatan (Fãtır) 35:9-18

value: GOD is the One who sends the winds to stir up clouds, then we drive them towards barren lands, and revive such lands after they were dead. Thus is the resurrection.

Anyone seeking dignity should know that to GOD belongs all dignity. To Him ascends the good words, and He exalts the righteous works. As for those who scheme evil works, they incur severe retribution; the scheming of such people is destined to fail.
YENİSİ: İtibar arayan herkes bilmelidir ki, tüm itibar TANRI’ya aittir. Bütün güzel sözler O’na yükselir ve doğru işleri de O yükseltir. Kötü işler düzenleyenlere gelince, onlar şiddetli azabı üzerlerine çekerler; böylesi insanların planlaması başarısızlığa mahkûmdur.

value: GOD created you from dust, then from a tiny drop, then He causes you to reproduce through your spouses. No female becomes pregnant, nor gives birth, without His knowledge. No one survives for a long life, and no one’s life is snapped short, except in accordance with a pre-existing record. This is easy for GOD.

The two seas are not the same; one is fresh and delicious, while the other is salty and undrinkable. From each of them you eat tender meat, and extract jewelry to wear. And you see the ships sailing through them, seeking His provisions, that you may be appreciative.

He merges the night into the day, and merges the day into the night. He has committed the sun and the moon to run for a predetermined period of time. Such is GOD your Lord; to Him belongs all kingship. Any idols you set up beside Him do not possess as much as a seed’s shell.
YENİSİ: O, geceyi gündüzün içine katar ve gündüzü gecenin içine katar. Güneşi ve ayı, önceden belirlenmiş bir süre boyunca seyretmeleri için görevlendirmiştir. İşte Rabbiniz TANRI böyledir; bütün krallık O’na aittir. O’nun yanında edindiğiniz putların hiçbiri, bir tohumun kabuğu kadar bile bir şeye sahip değildir.

value: If you call on them, they cannot hear you. Even if they hear you, they cannot respond to you. On the Day of Resurrection, they will disown you. None can inform you like the Most Cognizant.
YENİSİ: Eğer onlara çağrıda bulunursanız sizi işitemezler. Sizi işitseler bile size yanıt veremezler. Diriliş Günü’nde ise sizi sahiplenmeyecekler. En Haberdar Olan gibi kimse sana haber veremez.

value: O people, you are the ones who need GOD, while GOD is in no need of anyone, the Most Praiseworthy.
If He wills, He can get rid of you and substitute a new creation.
This is not too difficult for GOD.

No soul can carry the sins of another soul. If a soul that is loaded with sins implores another to bear part of its load, no other soul can carry any part of it, even if they were related. The only people to heed your warnings are those who reverence their Lord, even when alone in their privacy, and observe the Contact Prayers (Salat). Whoever purifies his soul, does so for his own good. To GOD is the final destiny.
YENİSİ: Hiçbir nefis, bir başka nefsin günahlarını yüklenemez. Eğer günahlarla yüklenmiş bir nefis, kendi yükünün bir kısmını yüklenmesi için bir başkasına yalvarsa, hiçbir başka nefis ondan herhangi bir kısmı taşıyamaz, akraba olsalar bile. Senin uyarılarına kulak veren yegâne insanlar, mahremiyetlerinde yalnızken dahi Rablerine derin saygı duyanlar ve İletişim Dualarını (Namazı) yerine getirenlerdir. Kim nefsini arındırırsa bunu kendi iyiliği için yapar. Son varış TANRI’yadır.

value: All Dignity\nBelongs With God
God is in Full Control
Appreciating God’s Greatness*
The Idols\nUtterly Powerless*

*35:12-13 When we send our astronauts into space, we provide them with their minimum needs of food, water, and oxygen. When we sided with Satan’s blasphemy billions of years ago (Appendix 7), God launched us into space aboard the spaceship Earth. But God has supplied our spaceship with awesome renewable systems that provide a great variety of fresh foods, water, oxygen, and even the reproduction of us astronauts.
*35:14 People idolize Jesus, Mary, Muhammad, Ali, and/or the saints; such idols are dead, unaware, and utterly powerless. Even when they were alive, they were powerless.
YENİSİ: *35:14 İnsanlar İsa’yı, Meryem’i, Muhammed’i, Ali’yi ve/veya azizleri putlaştırırlar; bu tür putlar ölmüş, habersiz ve tamamen güçsüzdürler. Onlar hayatta iken bile güçsüzlerdi.

value: Initiator (Fãter) 35:19-35
YENİSİ: Başlatan (Fãtır) 35:19-35

value: The blind and the seer are not equal.
YENİSİ: Kör ile gören eşit değildir.

value: Nor are the darkness and the light.
Nor are the coolness of the shade and the heat of the sun.
Nor are the living and the dead; GOD causes whomever He wills to hear. You cannot make hearers out of those in the graves.
You are no more than a warner.
YENİSİ: Sen bir uyarıcıdan fazlası değilsin.

value: We have sent you* with the truth, a bearer of good news, as well as a warner. Every community must receive a warner.
YENİSİ: Biz seni* bir müjdeleyici, aynı zamanda bir uyarıcı olarak hakikat ile gönderdik. Her topluluk bir uyarıcı almak zorundadır.

value: If they disbelieve you, those before them have also disbelieved. Their messengers went to them with clear proofs, and the Psalms, and the enlightening scriptures.
Subsequently, I punished those who disbelieved; how terrible was My retribution!

Do you not realize that GOD sends down from the sky water, whereby we produce fruits of various colors? Even the mountains have different colors; the peaks are white, or red, or some other color. And the ravens are black.
Also, the people, the animals, and the livestock come in various colors. This is why the people who truly reverence GOD are those who are knowledgeable. GOD is Almighty, Forgiving.
YENİSİ: Ayrıca insanlar, hayvanlar ve çiftlik hayvanları çeşitli renklerde olurlar. Bu nedenle, TANRI’ya tam olarak derin saygı duyan insanlar, bilgili olanlardır. TANRI Kudretlidir, Bağışlayandır.

value: Surely, those who recite the book of GOD, observe the Contact Prayers (Salat), and from our provisions to them they spend—secretly and publicly—are engaged in an investment that never loses.
YENİSİ: Şüphesiz, TANRI’nın kitabını okuyanlar, İletişim Dualarını (Namazı) gözetenler ve kendilerine sağladığımız rızıklardan—gizlice ve alenen—harcayanlar, asla kayba uğramayan bir yatırıma girişmektedirler.

value: He will recompense them generously, and will multiply His blessings upon them. He is Forgiving, Appreciative.
What we revealed to you in this scripture is the truth, consummating all previous scriptures. GOD is fully Cognizant of His servants, Seer.

We passed the scripture from generation to generation, and we allowed whomever we chose from among our servants to receive it. Subsequently, some of them wronged their souls, others upheld it only part of the time, while others were eager to work righteousness in accordance with GOD’s will; this is the greatest triumph.
YENİSİ: Biz kutsal yazıyı kuşaktan kuşağa aktardık ve onu kullarımız arasından kimi seçtiysek onun almasına izin verdik. Ardından, onlardan bazıları nefislerine haksızlık ettiler, diğerleri ise sadece zaman zaman ona bağlı kaldılar, bir kısmı da TANRI’nın iradesine uygun olarak doğruluğa çalışmaya istekliydi; işte en büyük zafer budur.

value: They will enter the gardens of Eden, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments in it will be made of silk.
They will say, “Praise GOD for removing all our worries. Our Lord is Forgiving, Appreciative.
“He has admitted us into the abode of eternal bliss, out of His grace. Never do we get bored herein, never do we get tired.”
God’s Messenger of the Covenant*
God’s Colorful Creations
YENİSİ: Tanrı’nın Rengârenk Yaratımları

YENİSİ: Başlatan (Fãtır) 35:36-45 & Y. S. (Yã Sîn) 36:1-2

value: As for those who disbelieve, they have incurred the fire of Hell, where they are never finished by death, nor is the retribution ever commuted for them. We thus requite the unappreciative.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenlere gelince, Cehennemin ateşini üzerlerine çekmişlerdir; orada ne ölüm onları sona erdirir, ne de azap onlar için hafifletilir. Biz nankörlere işte böyle karşılık veririz.

value: They will scream therein, “Our Lord, if you get us out of here, we will work righteousness, instead of the works we used to do.” Did we not give you a life-long chance, with continuous reminders for those who would take heed? Did you not receive the warner? Therefore, taste (the consequences). The transgressors will have no one to help them.
YENİSİ: Orada şöyle haykırırlar: “Rabbimiz, eğer bizi buradan çıkarırsan, vaktiyle yaptığımız işler yerine doğruluğa çalışacağız.” Biz size, dikkate alabilecekler için aralıksız hatırlatmalar ile bir ömür boyu şans vermedik mi? Uyarıcı almadınız mı? Öyleyse, (sonuçlarını) tadın. Haddi aşanların kendilerine yardım edecek hiç kimsesi olmayacaktır.

value: GOD is the Knower of the future of the heavens and the earth. He is the Knower of all innermost thoughts.

He is the One who made you inheritors of the earth. Subsequently, whoever chooses to disbelieve does so to his own detriment. The disbelief of the disbelievers only augments their Lord’s abhorrence towards them. The disbelief of the disbelievers plunges them deeper into loss.
YENİSİ: Sizi yeryüzünün vârisleri yapan O’dur. Sonrasında, kim inkâr etmeyi seçerse bunu kendi aleyhine yapar. İnkârcıların inkârı, sadece Rablerinin onlara karşı iğrenmesini artırır. İnkârcıların inkârı, onları zarar içine daha derin saplar.

value: Say, “Consider the idols you have set up beside GOD; show me what on earth have they created.” Do they own any partnership in the heavens? Have we given them a book wherein there is no doubt? Indeed, what the transgressors promise one another is no more than an illusion.
GOD is the One who holds the heavens and the earth, lest they vanish. If anyone else is to hold them, they will most certainly vanish. He is Clement, Forgiving.
YENİSİ: Gökleri ve yeryüzünü ortadan yok olmasınlar diye tutan TANRI’dır. Eğer onları bir başkasının tutması gerekse, onlar kesinlikle ortadan yok olurlar. O Hoşgörülüdür, Bağışlayandır.

value: They swore by GOD solemnly that if a warner went to them, they would be better guided than a certain congregation! However, now that the warner did come to them, this only plunged them deeper into aversion.
YENİSİ: Onlara bir uyarıcı giderse, kendilerine belirli bir cemaatten daha iyi rehberlik edileceğine dair TANRI adına ciddiyetle yemin ettiler! Oysaki onlara uyarıcı geldi, bu sadece onları tiksinti içine daha derin sapladı.

value: They resorted to arrogance on earth, and evil scheming, and the evil schemes only backfire on those who scheme them. Should they then expect anything but the fate of those who did the same things in the past? You will find that GOD’s system is never changeable; you will find that GOD’s system is immutable.
YENİSİ: Onlar yeryüzünde kibre ve kötü planlamaya başvurdular, ve kötü planlar yalnızca onları planlayanların üzerine geri teper. O zaman onlar geçmişte aynı şeyleri yapanların akıbetinden başka herhangi bir şey mi beklemeliler? TANRI’nın sisteminin asla değişken olmadığını bulacaksınız; TANRI’nın sisteminin değişmez olduğunu bulacaksınız.

value: Have they not roamed the earth and noted the consequences for those who preceded them? They were even stronger than they. Nothing can be hidden from GOD in the heavens, nor on earth. He is Omniscient, Omnipotent.

If GOD punished the people for their sins, He would not leave a single creature on earth. But He respites them for a predetermined interim. Once their interim is fulfilled, then GOD is Seer of His servants.
YENİSİ: Eğer TANRI insanları günahları yüzünden cezalandırsaydı, yeryüzünde tek bir yaratık bile bırakmazdı. Fakat O, onlara önceden belirlenmiş bir geçici süre için mühlet verir. Geçici süreleri tamamlandığında, o zaman TANRI kullarını Görendir.

value: *36:1 See Appendix 1 for the detailed explanation of these initials.
Most assuredly, you (Rashad) are one of the messengers.*
YENİSİ: Muhakkak ki sen (Reşad) elçilerden birisin.*

value: On a straight path.
YENİSİ: Dosdoğru bir yol üzerinde.

value: This revelation is from the Almighty, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Bu vahiy, Kudretli ve En Merhametli Olan’dandır.

value: To warn people whose parents were never warned, and therefore, they are unaware.
YENİSİ: Ebeveynleri hiçbir zaman uyarılmamış olan insanları uyarmak içindir ve bu nedenle, onlar habersizdirler.

value: It has been predetermined that most of them do not believe.
YENİSİ: Onların çoğunun inanmaması önceden belirlenmiştir.

value: For we place around their necks shackles, up to their chins. Consequently, they become locked in their disbelief.
YENİSİ: Zira biz onların boyunlarının etrafına, çenelerine kadar prangalar takarız. Sonuç olarak, inkârlarında kilitli hâle gelirler.

value: And we place a barrier in front of them, and a barrier behind them, and thus, we veil them; they cannot see.
YENİSİ: Ve onların önlerine bir bariyer, arkalarına da bir bariyer koyarız; ve böylece onları perdeleriz; göremezler.

value: It is the same whether you warn them or not, they cannot believe.*
You will be heeded only by those who uphold this message, and reverence the Most Gracious—even when alone in their privacy. Give them good news of forgiveness and a generous recompense.
YENİSİ: Sen sadece bu mesaja bağlı kalanlar ve En Lütufkâr Olan’a—mahremiyetlerinde yalnız olduklarında dahi—derin saygı duyanlar tarafından dikkate alınacaksın. Onlara bağışlanmanın ve cömert bir mükâfatın müjdesini ver.

value: We will certainly revive the dead, and we have recorded everything they have done in this life, as well as the consequences that continue after their death. Everything we have counted in a profound record.
Cite for them the example of people in a community that received the messengers.
When we sent to them two (messengers), they disbelieved them. We then supported them by a third. They said, “We are (God’s) messengers to you.”
They said, “You are no more than human beings like us. The Most Gracious did not send down anything. You are liars.”
They said, “Our Lord knows that we have been sent to you.
“Our sole mission is to deliver the message.”
They said, “We consider you bad omens. Unless you refrain, we will surely stone you, or afflict you with painful retribution.”
They said, “Your omen depends on your response, now that you have been reminded. Indeed, you are transgressing people.”
A man came from the other end of the city, saying, “O my people, follow the messengers.
YENİSİ: Şehrin öteki ucundan bir adam şöyle diyerek geldi: “Ey halkım, elçilere uyun.

value: “Follow those who do not ask you for any wage, and are guided.
“Why should I not worship the One who initiated me, and to Him is your ultimate return?
“Shall I set up beside Him gods? If the Most Gracious willed any harm for me, their intercession cannot help me one bit, nor can they rescue me.
“In that case, I would be totally astray.
Rejecting The Messengers: A Tragic Human Trait*
YENİSİ: Elçileri Reddetmek: Trajik Bir İnsan Özelliği*

YENİSİ: Liderler duyurdular: “Gidin ve tanrılarınıza tapınmakta kararlılıkla sebat edin. Arzu edilen budur.

value: “We never heard of this from the religion of our fathers. This is a lie.
YENİSİ: “Biz babalarımızın dininden bunu hiç işitmedik. Bu bir yalan.

value: “Why did the proof come down to him, instead of us?” Indeed, they are doubtful of My proof. Indeed, they have not yet tasted My retribution.
YENİSİ: “Kanıt neden bizim yerimize ona indi?” Gerçekten de onlar Benim kanıtımdan kuşku duymaktadırlar. Gerçekten de onlar Benim azabımı henüz tatmadılar.

value: Do they own the treasures of mercy of your Lord, the Almighty, the Grantor.
Do they possess the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them? Let them help themselves.
YENİSİ: Göklerin ve yeryüzünün ve onlar arasındaki her şeyin hükümranlığına sahipler mi? Varsın kendi kendilerine yardım etsinler.

value: Instead, whatever forces they can muster—even if all their parties banded together—will be defeated.
Disbelieving before them were the people of Noah, ‘Ãd, and the mighty Pharaoh.
Also, Thamoud, the people of Lot, the dwellers of the Woods (of Midyan); those were the opponents.
YENİSİ: Ayrıca, Semûd, Lut halkı, (Midyan’ın) Orman sakinleri de; bunlar muhaliflerdi.

value: Each of them disbelieved the messengers and thus, My retribution was inevitable.
These people can expect a single blow, from which they never recover.
They challenged: “Our Lord, why do you not rush the retribution for us, before the Day of Reckoning.”
YENİSİ: Meydan okudular: “Rabbimiz, Hesap Günü’nden önce neden bizim için azabı çabuklaştırmıyorsun?”

value: Be patient in the face of their utterances, and remember our servant David, the resourceful; he was obedient.
We committed the mountains in his service, glorifying with him night and day.
Also the birds were committed to serve him; all were obedient to him.
We strengthened his kingship, and endowed him with wisdom and good logic.
YENİSİ: Onun krallığını güçlendirdik, ona bilgelik ve sağlam bir mantık bahşettik.

value: Have you received news of the feuding men who sneaked into his sanctuary?
When they entered his room, he was startled. They said, “Have no fear. We are feuding with one another, and we are seeking your fair judgment. Do not wrong us, and guide us in the right path.
“This brother of mine owns ninety nine* sheep, while I own one sheep. He wants to mix my sheep with his, and continues to pressure me.”
*38:23 This is the only place where the number 99 occurs. Thirty different numbers are mentioned in the Quran, and their total comes to 162146, 19x8534. See Appendix 1.
YENİSİ: *38:23 Burası, 99 sayısının geçtiği tek yerdir. Kuran’da otuz farklı sayıdan bahsedilmektedir ve toplamları 162146, 19x8534’tür. Ek 1’e bakınız.

value: He said, “He is being unfair to you by asking to combine your sheep with his. Most people who combine their properties treat each other unfairly, except those who believe and work righteousness, and these are so few.” Afterwards, David wondered if he made the right judgment. He thought that we were testing him. He then implored his Lord for forgiveness, bowed down, and repented.*
YENİSİ: Dedi ki: “Senin koyunlarını onunkiyle birleştirmeyi isteyerek sana haksızlık ediyor. Mallarını birleştiren insanların çoğu birbirlerine haksızca davranır; inanan ve doğruluğa çalışanlar hariç, bunlar da pek azdır.” Devamında Davut, doğru hüküm verip vermediğini merak etti. Bizim onu test ettiğimizi düşündü. Ardından Rabbine bağışlanma için yalvardı, rükû etti ve tövbe etti.

value: We forgave him in this matter. We have granted him a position of honor with us, and a beautiful abode.

O David, we have made you a ruler on earth. Therefore, you shall judge among the people equitably, and do not follow your personal opinion, lest it diverts you from the way of GOD. Surely, those who stray off the way of GOD incur severe retribution for forgetting the Day of Reckoning.
YENİSİ: Ey Davut, seni yeryüzünde bir hükümdar yaptık. Bu nedenle, insanlar arasında adil bir şekilde hüküm ver ve seni TANRI’nın yolundan saptırmaması için şahsi görüşünü takip etme. Şüphesiz, TANRI’nın yolundan sapanlar, Hesap Günü’nü unuttukları için şiddetli azabı üzerlerine çekerler.

value: We did not create the heaven and the earth, and everything between them, in vain. Such is the thinking of those who disbelieve. Therefore, woe to those who disbelieve; they will suffer in Hell.
YENİSİ: Biz göğü ve yeryüzünü ve aralarındaki her şeyi, boşuna yaratmadık. İşte bu, inkâr edenlerin düşüncesidir. Bu nedenle, yazıklar olsun inkâr edenlere; onlar Cehennemde acı çekecekler.

value: Shall we treat those who believe and lead a righteous life as we treat those who commit evil on earth? Shall we treat the righteous as we treat the wicked?
This is a scripture that we sent down to you, that is sacred—perhaps they reflect on its verses. Those who possess intelligence will take heed.
YENİSİ: Bu, sana indirdiğimiz bir metindir, kutsaldır—belki onun ayetleri üzerine derinlemesine düşünürler. Akıl sahipleri dikkate alacaklardır.

value: To David we granted Solomon; a good and obedient servant.
One day he became preoccupied with beautiful horses, until the night fell.
YENİSİ: Bir gün, gece çökünceye kadar zihni güzel atlarla meşgul oldu.

value: He then said, “I enjoyed the material things more than I enjoyed worshiping my Lord, until the sun was gone.*
YENİSİ: Ardından dedi ki: “Ben, güneş kayboluncaya dek, Rabbime tapınmanın tadını çıkarmaktan daha çok maddiyatın tadını çıkardım.*

value: “Bring them back.” (To bid farewell,) he rubbed their legs and necks.
YENİSİ: “Onları geri getirin.” (Veda etmek için,) bacaklarını ve boyunlarını okşadı.

value: We thus put Solomon to the test; we blessed him with vast material wealth, but he steadfastly submitted.*
YENİSİ: Biz böylece Süleyman’ı test ettik; onu çok büyük maddi zenginlikle nimetlendirdik, fakat o kararlılıkla teslim oldu.*

value: He said, “My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingship never attained by anyone else. You are the Grantor.”
YENİSİ: Dedi ki: “Rabbim, beni bağışla ve bana başka hiç kimse tarafından hiçbir zaman erişilmemiş bir krallık bahşet. Sen Bahşedicisin.”

value: We (answered his prayer and) committed the wind at his disposal, pouring rain wherever he wanted.
And the devils, building and diving.
Others were placed at his disposal.
“This is our provision to you; you may give generously, or withhold, without limits.”
YENİSİ: “Sana ihsanımız budur; sınır olmaksızın, cömertçe verebilirsin yahut kısıtlayabilirsin.”

value: David’s Exemplary Piety
YENİSİ: Davut’un Örnek Takvası

value: Solomon’s Exemplary Devotion
*38:24 In this clear example, 99 on one side vs. 1 on the other side, David’s extreme care to render the correct judgment caused him to ask forgiveness. Are we this careful?
*38:32 Solomon missed his afternoon prayer because of his horses. To nullify Satan’s possible claim that Solomon loved his horses more than loving God, he got rid of his horses.
*38:34 & 38:41 Solomon and Job represent both ends of the testing spectrum. We are put to the test through wealth, health, or lack of them, to see if we worship God alone under all circumstances.
He has deserved an honorable position with us, and a wonderful abode.
YENİSİ: O, katımızda şerefli bir konum ve harika bir mesken hak etmiştir.

value: Remember our servant Job: he called upon his Lord, “The devil has afflicted me with hardship and pain.”
“Strike the ground with your foot. A spring will give you healing and a drink.”
We restored his family for him; twice as many. Such is our mercy; a reminder for those who possess intelligence.
YENİSİ: Biz, ona ailesini iki katıyla geri verdik. İşte bizim merhametimiz böyledir; akıl sahipleri için bir hatırlatıcı.

value: “Now, you shall travel the land and preach the message, to fulfill your pledge.” We found him steadfast. What a good servant! He was a submitter.
Remember also our servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. They were resourceful, and possessed vision.
We bestowed upon them a great blessing: awareness of the Hereafter.
They were chosen, for they were among the most righteous.
Remember Ismail, Elisha, and ZalKifl; among the most righteous.
This is a reminder: The righteous have deserved a wonderful destiny.
YENİSİ: Bu bir hatırlatıcıdır: Doğrular mükemmel bir kaderi hak etmişlerdir.

value: The gardens of Eden will open up their gates for them.
Relaxing therein, they will be given many kinds of fruits and drinks.
They will have wonderful spouses.
YENİSİ: Harika eşlere sahip olacaklardır.

value: This is what you have deserved on the Day of Reckoning.
YENİSİ: Bu, sizin Hesap Günü’nde hak ettiğiniz şeydir.

value: Our provisions are inexhaustible.
As for the transgressors, they have incurred a miserable destiny.
YENİSİ: Haddi aşanlara gelince, onlar sefil bir kaderi üzerlerine çekmişlerdir.

value: Hell is where they burn; what a miserable abode!
YENİSİ: Cehennem onların yanacakları yerdir; ne sefil bir mesken!

value: What they taste therein will be hellish drinks and bitter food.
And much more of the same kind.
“This is a group to be thrown into Hell with you.” They will not be welcomed (by the residents of Hell). They have deserved to burn in the hellfire.
YENİSİ: “Bu, sizinle birlikte Cehenneme atılacak bir topluluktur.” Onlar (Cehennem sakinleri tarafından) hoş karşılanmayacaklar. Onlar cehennem ateşinde yanmayı hak etmişlerdir.

value: The newcomers will respond, “Nor are you welcomed. You are the ones who preceded us and misled us. Therefore, suffer this miserable end.”
YENİSİ: Yeni gelenler yanıt verecekler: “Siz de hoş karşılanmıyorsunuz. Siz, bizden önce gelen ve bizi saptıran kimselersiniz. Bu nedenle, bu sefil sonu çekin.”

value: They will also say, “Our Lord, these are the ones who led us into this; double the retribution of hellfire for them.”
They will say, “How come we do not see (in Hell) people we used to count among the wicked?
“We used to ridicule them; we used to turn our eyes away from them.”
This is a predetermined fact: the people of Hell will feud with one another.
Say, “I warn you; there is no other god beside GOD, the One, the Supreme.
YENİSİ: De ki, “Sizi uyarıyorum; Tek ve En Üstün Olan TANRI’nın yanında başka bir tanrı yoktur.

value: The Devil Afflicts Job*
God Makes it up to the Believers
The Righteous
The Disbelievers: Feuding With One Another
Surprise!
*38:41 See footnote for 38:34 & 38:41.
S. (Saad) 38:66-88 & The Throngs (Al-Zumar) 39:1-4
YENİSİ: S. (Sad) 38:66-88 & Yığınlar (El-Zümer) 39:1-4

value: “The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them; the Almighty, the Forgiving.”
Say, “Here is awesome news.
“That you are totally oblivious to.
YENİSİ: “Ki siz ona karşı tamamen gaflettesiniz.

value: “I had no knowledge previously, about the feud in the High Society.*
YENİSİ: “Yüksek Toplumdaki kavga hakkında daha önce hiçbir bilgim yoktu.*

value: “I am inspired that my sole mission is to deliver the warnings to you.”
YENİSİ: “Bana, tek görevimin size uyarıları iletmek olduğu ilham edilmektedir.”

value: Your Lord said to the angels, “I am creating a human being from clay.
YENİSİ: Rabbin meleklere dedi ki: “Ben çamurdan bir insan yaratıyorum.

value: “Once I design him, and blow into him from My spirit, you shall fall prostrate before him.”
YENİSİ: “Onu tasarlayıp ona Benim ruhumdan üflediğimde, onun önünde secdeye kapanın.”

value: The angels fell prostrate, all of them,
YENİSİ: Melekler secdeye kapandılar, hepsi,

value: except Satan; he refused, and was too arrogant, unappreciative.
YENİSİ: Şeytan hariç; o reddetti ve çok kibirliydi, nankördü.

value: He said, “O Satan, what prevented you from prostrating before what I created with My hands? Are you too arrogant? Have you rebelled?”
YENİSİ: O Dedi ki: “Ey Şeytan, seni Kendi ellerimle yarattığıma secde etmekten ne engelledi? Çok mu kibirlisin? İsyan mı ettin?”

value: He said, “I am better than he; You created me from fire, and created him from clay.”
YENİSİ: Dedi ki: “Ben ondan daha iyiyim; Sen beni ateşten yarattın ve onu çamurdan yarattın.”

value: He said, “Therefore, you must be exiled, you will be banished.
YENİSİ: O Dedi ki: “O hâlde, sürülmek zorundasın, sen sürgün edileceksin.

value: “You have incurred My condemnation until the Day of Judgment.”
YENİSİ: “Diriliş Günü’ne kadar Benim kınamamı üzerine çektin.”

value: He said, “My Lord, respite me till the Day of Resurrection.”
YENİSİ: Dedi ki: “Rabbim, Diriliş Günü’ne kadar bana mühlet ver.”

value: He said, “You are respited.
YENİSİ: O Dedi ki: “Sana mühlet verildi.

value: “Until the appointed day.”
YENİSİ: “Belirlenmiş güne kadar.”

value: He said, “I swear by Your majesty, that I will send them all astray.
“Except Your worshipers who are devoted absolutely to You alone.”
He said, “This is the truth, and the truth is all that I utter.
“I will fill Hell with you and all those who follow you.”
Say, “I do not ask you for any wage, and I am not an imposter.
“This is a reminder for the world.
“And you will certainly find out in awhile.”
The Great Feud
This is a revelation of the scripture, from GOD, the Almighty, the Wise.
We sent down to you this scripture, truthfully; you shall worship GOD, devoting your religion to Him alone.

Absolutely, the religion shall be devoted to GOD alone. Those who set up idols beside Him say, “We idolize them only to bring us closer to GOD; for they are in a better position!” GOD will judge them regarding their disputes. GOD does not guide such liars, disbelievers.
YENİSİ: Kesinlikle, din yalnızca TANRI’ya adanmalıdır. O’nun yanında putlar edinenler, “Biz sadece bizi TANRI’ya yaklaştırsınlar diye onları putlaştırıyoruz; zira onlar daha iyi bir konumdalar!” derler. TANRI ihtilaflarına dair onları yargılayacaktır. TANRI böylesi yalancılara, inkârcılara rehberlik etmez.

value: If GOD wanted to have a son, He could have chosen whomever He willed from among His creations. Be He glorified; He is GOD, the One, the Supreme.
YENİSİ: Eğer TANRI bir oğula sahip olmak isteseydi, yarattıkları arasından irade ettiğini seçebilirdi. O’na yücelik olsun. O, Tek ve En Üstün Olan TANRI’dır.
