YENİSİ: Süs Eşyası (El-Zuhruf) 43:3-21

value: We have rendered it an Arabic Quran, that you may understand.*
It is preserved with us in the original master, honorable and full of wisdom.
Should we just ignore the fact that you have transgressed the limits?*
We have sent many a prophet to the previous generations.
YENİSİ: Biz önceki nesillere birçok peygamber gönderdik.

value: Every time a prophet went to them, they ridiculed him.
Consequently, we annihilated people who were even more powerful than these. We thus set the examples from the previous communities.
YENİSİ: Sonuç olarak, bunlardan bile daha güçlü insanları imha ettik. Biz böylece, önceki toplumlardan emsaller yerleştirdik.

value: If you asked them, “Who created the heavens and the earth,” they would say, “The Almighty, the Omniscient has created them.”
He is the One who made the earth habitable for you, and created for you roads therein, that you may follow the right way.
YENİSİ: Yeryüzünü sizin için yaşanabilir kılan ve doğru yolu takip edesiniz diye sizin için onda yollar yaratan O'dur.

value: He is the One who sends down from the sky water, in exact measure, to revive dead lands therewith. Similarly, you will be resurrected.
He is the One who created all kinds, in pairs (male and female), and He created for you ships and livestock to ride.
As you rest on top of them, you shall appreciate such a blessing from your Lord, and say, “Glory be to the One who subdued this for us. We could not have controlled them by ourselves.
“We ultimately return to our Lord.”
YENİSİ: “Biz en nihayetinde Rabbimize geri döneriz.”

value: They even assigned for Him a share from His own creation! Surely, the human being is profoundly unappreciative.
Has He chosen from among His creations daughters for Himself, while blessing you with sons?
When one of them is given news (of a daughter) as they claimed for the Most Gracious, his face is darkened with misery and anger!
YENİSİ: Onlardan birine, En Lütufkâr Olan için olduğunu iddia ettikleri üzere (bir kız çocuğu) haberi verildiğinde, yüzü perişanlık ve öfke ile kararır!

value: (They say,) “What is good about an offspring that is brought up to be beautiful, and cannot help in war?”
They claimed that the angels, who are servants of the Most Gracious, are females! Have they witnessed their creation? Their claims are recorded, and they will be asked.
They even said, “If the Most Gracious willed, we would not have worshiped them.” They have no basis for such a claim; they only conjecture.*
YENİSİ: Hatta dediler ki “Eğer En Lütufkâr Olan irade etseydi biz onlara tapmazdık.” Böyle bir iddia için hiçbir temelleri yok; sadece zanda bulunuyorlar.*

value: Have we given them a book before this, and they are upholding it?
YENİSİ: Biz onlara bundan önce bir kitap verdik de ona mı bağlı kalıyorlar?

value: The Plan for Redemption
Angels As Daughters: A Blasphemy

*43:3 Arabic is the most efficient language, especially in expressing commandments, statutes and exacting laws. Hence the revelation of the Quran in Arabic for the clear understanding of all peoples, regardless of their tongues. See Appendix 4 for the details.
*43:5 This refers to our original sin as detailed in the Introduction and Appendix 7.
*43:20 The idol worshipers cannot blame God for their idolatry, since we have absolute freedom of choice to worship God alone, or not.
Ornaments (Al-Zukhruf) 43:22-37
YENİSİ: Süs Eşyası (El-Zuhruf) 43:22-37

value: The fact is: they said, “We found our parents carrying on certain practices, and we are following in their footsteps.”
YENİSİ: Gerçek şu ki: onlar, “Ebeveynlerimizi belirli uygulamaları sürdürürken bulduk ve biz onların izlerinden gidiyoruz” dediler.

value: Invariably, when we sent a warner to any community, the leaders of that community would say, “We found our parents following certain practices, and we will continue in their footsteps.”
YENİSİ: Aynı şekilde, herhangi bir topluluğa bir uyarıcı gönderdiğimizde, o topluluğun liderleri şöyle derlerdi: “Biz ebeveynlerimizi belirli uygulamaları uygularken bulduk ve biz onların izlerinden gitmeye devam edeceğiz.”

value: (The messenger) would say, “What if I brought to you better guidance than what you inherited from your parents?” They would say, “We are disbelievers in the message you brought.”
YENİSİ: (Elçi) derdi ki: “Ya size ebeveynlerinizden miras aldığınız şeyden daha iyi rehberlik getirdiysem?” Onlar da, “Biz, senin getirdiğin mesajın inkârcılarıyız” derlerdi.

value: Consequently, we requited them Note the consequences for the rejectors.
YENİSİ: Neticede onlara karşılığını verdik. Reddediciler için sonuçlara dikkat et.

value: Abraham said to his father and his people, “I disown what you worship.
YENİSİ: İbrahim, babasına ve halkına dedi ki: “Ben sizin taptığınız şeyleri sahiplenmiyorum.

value: “Only the One who initiated me can guide me.”
YENİSİ: “Sadece beni başlatan O bana rehberlik edebilir.”

value: This example (of Abraham) was rendered an everlasting lesson for subsequent generations; perhaps they redeem their souls.
YENİSİ: (İbrahim’in) bu örneği, sonraki nesiller için daimi bir ders haline getirildi ki belki de nefislerini kurtarırlar.

value: Indeed, I have given these people and their ancestors sufficient chances, then the truth came to them, and a clarifying messenger.
When the truth came to them, they said, “This is magic, and we are disbelievers therein.”
They said, “If only this Quran was sent down through another man from the two communities (Mecca or Yathrib) who is prominent!”

Are they the ones who assign your Lord’s mercy? We have assigned their shares in this life, raising some of them above others in ranks, in order to let them serve one another. The mercy from your Lord is far better than any material they may hoard.
YENİSİ: Rabbinin merhametini tayin edenler onlar mı? Biz, birbirlerine hizmet etsinler diye bazılarını dereceler bakımından diğerlerinin üstüne yükselterek bu hayattaki paylarını tayin ettik. Rabbinden gelen merhamet, istifleyebilecekleri her maddi şeyden çok daha iyidir.

value: If it were not that all the people might become one (disbelieving) congregation, we would have granted everyone who disbelieves in the Most Gracious mansions with silver roofs, and stairs upon which they could climb.
YENİSİ: Eğer tüm insanların tek bir (inkâr eden) cemaat hâline gelme ihtimali olmasaydı, En Lütufkâr Olan’ı inkâr eden her bir kişiye gümüş çatıları ve üzerinde tırmanabilecekleri merdivenleri olan köşkler bahşederdik.

value: Their mansions would have impressive gates, and luxurious furnishings.
Also many ornaments. All these are the temporary materials of this lowly life. The Hereafter—at your Lord—is far better for the righteous.
YENİSİ: Ayrıca birçok süs eşyası. Bütün bunlar, bu aşağı hayatın geçici metalarından ibarettir. Doğrular için Ahiret—Rabbinin katında—çok daha iyidir.

value: Anyone who disregards the message of the Most Gracious, we appoint a devil to be his constant companion.*
YENİSİ: Kim En Lütufkâr Olan’ın mesajını göz ardı ederse, ona sürekli yoldaş olacak bir şeytan atarız.*

value: Such companions will divert them from the path, yet make them believe that they are guided.
Inherited Traditions Condemned
Abraham’s Example
YENİSİ: İbrahim’in Örneği

value: Muhammad Ridiculed
YENİSİ: Muhammed’le Alay Edildi

value: Materials of This World:\nAll That The Disbelievers Get
YENİSİ: Bu Dünyanın Metaları:\nİnkârcıların Elde Ettiği Her Şey

value: Invisible, Devilish, Companions*
YENİSİ: Görünmez, Şeytani, Yoldaşlar*

value: *43:36-39 Each one of us has a representative of Satan as a constant companion (Appendix 7).
Ornaments (Al-Zukhruf) 43:38-58
YENİSİ: Süs Eşyası (El-Zuhruf) 43:38-58

value: When he comes before us he will say, “Oh I wish you were as far from me as the two easts.* What a miserable companion!”
YENİSİ: Bizim huzurumuza geldiğinde o diyecek ki: “Ah keşke sen benden iki doğu* kadar uzak olsaydın. Ne sefil bir yoldaş!”

value: It will not console you on that day, as transgressors, that both of you will share in the retribution.
Can you make the deaf hear; can you make the blind see, or those who are far astray?
Whether we let you die before it or not, we will surely requite them.
YENİSİ: İster seni ondan önce vefat ettirelim ister ettirmeyelim, onlara mutlaka karşılığını vereceğiz.

value: Or, we may show you (the retribution) we promised for them. We are in full control over them.
You shall steadfastly preach what is revealed to you; you are in the right path.*
This is a message for you and your people; all of you will be questioned.
Check the messengers we sent before you: “Have we ever appointed any other gods—beside the Most Gracious—to be worshiped?”
For example, we sent Moses with our proofs to Pharaoh and his elders, proclaiming: “I am a messenger from the Lord of the universe.”
When he showed them our proofs, they laughed at them.
Every sign we showed them was bigger than the one before it. We afflicted them with the plagues, perhaps they repent.
They said, “O you magician, implore your Lord on our behalf, since you have an agreement with Him (to relieve this plague); we will then be guided.”
YENİSİ: Dediler ki: “Ey sihirbaz, bizim yerimize Rabbine yalvar, çünkü senin (bu felaketi dindirmek için) O’nunla bir anlaşman var; biz o zaman rehberlik ediliriz.”

value: But as soon as we relieved their affliction, they reverted.
YENİSİ: Fakat onların sıkıntılarını dindirdiğimiz anda, onlar eskiye döndüler.

value: Pharaoh announced to his people, “O my people, do I not possess the kingship over Egypt, and these flowing rivers belong to me? Do you not see?
YENİSİ: Firavun halkına duyurdu: “Ey halkım, Mısır üzerindeki krallığa sahip değil miyim ve şu akan nehirler bana ait değil mi? Görmüyor musunuz?

value: “Which one is better; me or that one who is lowly and can hardly speak?
“How come he does not possess a treasure of gold; how come the angels do not accompany him?”
He thus fooled his people, and they obeyed him; they were wicked people.
YENİSİ: O böylece halkını kandırdı ve onlar ona itaat ettiler; onlar kötü insanlardı.

value: When they persisted in opposing us, we punished them and drowned them all.
We rendered them a precedent and an example for the others.
When the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people disregarded it.
YENİSİ: Meryem oğlu bir örnek olarak verildiği zaman, senin halkın onu göz ardı etti.

value: They said, “Is it better to worship our gods, or to worship him?” They said this only to argue with you. Indeed, they are people who have joined the opposition.
God’s Messenger of\nthe Covenant
Moses and Pharaoh
YENİSİ: Musa ve Firavun

value: Jesus: Another Example
*43:38 The “easts” imply the locations of sunrise, moonrise, and the rising of heavenly bodies.
*43:43 The sum of the gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230) plus 43 is 1273, 19x67.
Ornaments (Al-Zukhruf) 43:59-81
YENİSİ: Süs Eşyası (El-Zuhruf) 43:59-81

value: He was no more than a servant whom we blessed, and we sent him as an example for the Children of Israel.
If we willed, we could have made you angels who colonize and reproduce on earth.
He is to serve as a marker for knowing the end of the world, * so you can no longer harbor any doubt about it. You shall follow Me; this is the right path.
Let not the devil repel you; he is your most ardent enemy.
YENİSİ: Şeytanın sizi uzak tutmasına izin vermeyin; o sizin en azılı düşmanınızdır.

value: When Jesus went with the proofs, he said, “I bring to you wisdom, and to clarify some of the matters in which you dispute. You shall reverence GOD and obey me.
YENİSİ: İsa kanıtlarla gittiğinde dedi ki: “Ben size bilgelik getiriyorum ve ihtilafa düştüğünüz bazı hususları aydınlığa kavuşturuyorum. TANRI’ya derin saygı duyun ve bana itaat edin.

value: “GOD is my Lord and your Lord, you shall worship Him alone. This is the right path.”
YENİSİ: “TANRI benim de Rabbimdir sizin de Rabbinizdir, yalnızca O’na tapın. Bu doğru yoldur.”

value: The opponents disputed among themselves. Woe to those who transgress from the retribution of a painful day.
YENİSİ: Muhalifler kendi aralarında çekiştiler. Acı veren bir günün azabından ötürü yazıklar olsun haddi aşanlara.

value: Are they waiting for the Hour (Day of Judgment) to come to them suddenly when they least expect it?
The close friends on that day will become enemies of one another, except for the righteous.
O My servants, you will have no fear on that day, nor will you grieve.
They are the ones who believed in our revelations, and were submitters.
Enter Paradise, together with your spouses, and rejoice.
Offered to them will be golden trays and cups, and they will find everything the hearts desire and the eyes wish for. You live therein forever.
Such is the Paradise that you inherit, in return for your works.
You will have in it all kinds of fruits, from which you eat.
Surely, the guilty will abide in the retribution of Gehenna forever.
Never will the retribution be commuted for them; they will be confined therein.
It is not us who wronged them; it is they who wronged their own souls.
YENİSİ: Onlara haksızlık eden biz değildik, kendi nefislerine haksızlık edenler onlardı.

value: They will implore: “O Mãlek, let your Lord finish us off.” He will say, “You are staying forever.
“We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth.”
Have they schemed some scheme? We too are scheming.
YENİSİ: Onlar bir plan mı kurmuşlar? Biz de planlıyoruz.

value: Do they think that we do not hear their secrets and conspiracies? Yes indeed; our messengers are with them, recording.
Proclaim: “If the Most Gracious did have a son, I would still be the foremost worshiper.”
Jesus and the End of the World*
The Righteous
They Hate The Truth

*43:61 As detailed in Appendix 25, the End of the World is given in the Quran, and the birthdate of Jesus provided one of the significant signs that the calculations are correct. We learn that the world will end in the year 2280 (19x120) after the birth of Jesus (see 47:18). Additionally, both the lunar year (1710) & the solar year (2280) are divisible by 570 (19x30), the number of years from the birth of Jesus to the birth of Muhammad Thus, the birth date of Jesus is a marker.
Ornaments (Al-Zukhruf) 43:82-89 & Smoke (Al-Dukhãn) 44:1-17
YENİSİ: Süs Eşyası (El-Zuhruf) 43:82-89 & Duman (El-Duhan) 44:1-17

value: Be He glorified; He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord with the great dominion, far above their claims.
YENİSİ: O’na yücelik olsun. O, göklerin ve yeryüzünün Rabbidir, büyük egemenliğin Rabbidir, onların iddialarının çok ötesindedir.

value: Let them blunder and play until they meet their day that is awaiting them.
YENİSİ: Varsın onları bekleyen kendi günleri ile buluşuncaya dek bocalayıp oynasınlar.

value: He is the only One who is a deity in the heaven and a deity on earth. He is the Most Wise, the Omniscient.
YENİSİ: O gökte de bir mabut, yerde de bir mabut olan yegâne Kişidir. O, En Bilge Olan ve Her Şeyi Bilendir.

value: Most Exalted is the One who possesses all sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them. With Him is the knowledge about the Hour (end of the world), and to Him you will be returned.
YENİSİ: En Yüce Olan, göklerin ve yeryüzünün ve onlar arasındaki her şeyin hükümranlığına sahip olan O'dur. Saat (dünyanın sonu) ile ilgili bilgi O’nun yanındadır ve siz O’na geri döndürüleceksiniz.

value: None of those whom they idolize beside Him possess any power to intercede, unless their intercession coincides with the truth, and they fully know.
YENİSİ: Şefaatleri hakikat ile örtüşmediği ve onlar tam olarak bilmediği sürece O’nun yanında putlaştırdıklarından hiçbiri şefaat etmeye güç yetiremez.

value: If you asked them who created them, they would say, “GOD.” Why then did they deviate?
YENİSİ: Kimin onları yarattığını onlara sorsan, “TANRI” diyeceklerdir. O zaman neden saptılar?

value: It will be proclaimed: “O my Lord, these people do not believe.”
YENİSİ: İlan edilecektir: “Ey Rabbim, bu insanlar inanmıyorlar.”

value: You shall disregard them and say, “Peace;” they will surely find out.
YENİSİ: Sen onları görmezden gel ve “Esenlikler” de; onlar mutlaka öğrenecekler.

value: H.M.
YENİSİ: H.M.

value: And this enlightening scripture.
We have sent it down in a blessed night, for we are to warn.
In it (the scripture), every matter of wisdom is clarified.
It is a predetermined command from us that we send messengers.
This is a mercy from your Lord. He is the Hearer, the Omniscient.
YENİSİ: Bu, Rabbinden bir merhamettir. O İşitendir, Her Şeyi Bilendir.

value: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them. If only you could be certain!
There is no other god beside Him. He controls life and death; your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors.
Indeed, they are doubtful, heedless.
YENİSİ: Doğrusu, onlar kuşkuludurlar, aymazdırlar.

value: Therefore, watch for the day when the sky brings a profound smoke.*
YENİSİ: Bu nedenle, göğün esaslı bir duman getireceği günü kolla.*

value: It will envelope the people; this is a painful retribution.
YENİSİ: İnsanları saracaktır; bu, acı veren bir azaptır.

value: “Our Lord, relieve this retribution for us; we are believers.”
YENİSİ: “Rabbimiz, bu azabı bizim için dindir; biz inananlarız.”

value: Now that it is too late, they remember! An enlightening messenger had come to them.*
YENİSİ: Artık iş işten geçti ya, hatırlarlar! Onlara aydınlatıcı bir elçi gelmişti.*

value: But they turned away from him, saying, “Well educated, but crazy!”
YENİSİ: Fakat, “İyi eğitimli ama deli!” diyerek ondan yüz çevirdiler.

value: We will relieve the retribution for awhile; you will soon revert.
YENİSİ: Biz bir süreliğine azabı dindireceğiz; siz çok geçmeden eskiye döneceksiniz.

value: The day we strike the big stroke, we will avenge.
We have tested before them the people of Pharaoh; an honorable messenger went to them.
YENİSİ: Onlardan önce Firavun halkını test ettik; onlara şerefli bir elçi gitti.

value: The Smoke: A Major Prophecy*
God’s Messenger of the Covenant*

YENİSİ: Duman (El-Duhan) 44:18-54

value: Proclaiming: “Listen to me, servants of GOD. I am an honest messenger to you.”
And, “Do not transgress against GOD. I bring to you powerful proofs.
“I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, if you oppose me.
“If you do not wish to believe, then simply leave me alone.”
Subsequently, he implored his Lord: “These are wicked people.”
(God said,) “Travel with My servants during the night; you will be pursued.
“Cross the sea quickly; their troops will be drowned.”
Thus, they left behind many gardens and springs.
Crops and a luxurious life.
Blessings that they enjoyed.
All these we caused to be inherited by other people.
Neither the heaven, nor the earth wept over them, and they were not respited.
YENİSİ: Ne gök ne de yeryüzü onlara ağladı ve onlara mühlet verilmedi.

value: Meanwhile, we saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution.
YENİSİ: Bu esnada, İsrailoğullarını o küçük düşürücü zulümden kurtardık.

value: From Pharaoh; he was a tyrant.
We have chosen them from among all the people, knowingly.
We showed them so many proofs, which constituted a great test.
The present generations say,
“We only die the first death; we will never be resurrected!
“Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful.”
Are they better than the people of Tubba‘ and others before them? We annihilated them for their crimes.
YENİSİ: Onlar Tubba’ halkından ve onlardan önceki diğerlerinden daha mı iyiler? Biz onları suçları nedeniyle imha ettik.

value: We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them, just to play.
We created them for a specific purpose, but most of them do not know.
The Day of Decision awaits them all.
That is the day when no friend can help his friend in any way; no one can be helped.
YENİSİ: Bu, hiçbir dostun kendi dostuna hiçbir şekilde yardım edemeyeceği gündür; kimseye yardım edilemez.

value: Only those who attain mercy from GOD. He is the Almighty, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: TANRI’dan merhamete erişenler müstesna. O Kudretlidir, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: Surely, the tree of bitterness—
will provide the food for the sinful.
Like lye, it will boil in the stomachs.
Like the boiling of hellish drinks.
Take him and throw him into the center of Hell.
Then pour upon his head the retribution of the Inferno.
“Taste this; you were so powerful, so honorable.”
This is what you used to doubt.
The righteous will be in a secure position.
Enjoying gardens and springs.
Wearing velvet and satin; close to each other.
We grant them wonderful spouses.
YENİSİ: Onlara harika eşler bahşederiz.

value: Expect The Same Consequences
YENİSİ: Aynı Sonuçları Bekleyin

value: The Disbelievers
YENİSİ: İnkârcılar

YENİSİ: Doğrular

value: Smoke (Al-Dukhãn) 44:55-59 & Kneeling (Al-Jãtheyah) 45:1-14
YENİSİ: Duman (El-Duhan) 44:55-59 & Diz Çöküş (El-Casiye) 45:1-14

value: They enjoy in it all kinds of fruits, in perfect peace.
They do not taste death therein— beyond the first death*—and He has spared them the retribution of Hell.
Such is the blessing from your Lord. Such is the great triumph.
We have thus clarified it in your language, that they may take heed.
Therefore, wait; they too will have to wait.
The Righteous Do Not Really Die*
H.M.
YENİSİ: H.M.

value: The revelation of this scripture is from GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.
The heavens and the earth are full of proofs for the believers.
Also in your creation, and the creation of all the animals, there are proofs for people who are certain.

Also, the alternation of the night and the day, and the provisions that GOD sends down from the sky to revive dead lands, and the manipulation of the winds; all these are proofs for people who understand.
These are GOD’s revelations that we recite to you truthfully. In which Hadith other than GOD and His revelations do they believe?
YENİSİ: Bunlar, sana hakikate uygun olarak okuduğumuz TANRI’nın vahiyleridir. TANRI’dan ve O’nun vahiylerinden başka hangi Hadise inanırlar?

value: Woe to every fabricator, guilty.*
YENİSİ: Yazıklar olsun, her suçlu uydurucuya.*

value: The one who hears GOD’s revelations recited to him, then insists arrogantly on his way, as if he never heard them. Promise him a painful retribution.
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın vahiyleri kendisine okunduğunda işitip de ardından sanki onları hiç işitmemiş gibi kendi yolunda kibirlice ısrar eden kişi. İşte ona acı veren bir azabın sözünü ver.

value: When he learns anything about our revelations, he mocks them. These have incurred a shameful retribution.
YENİSİ: Vahiylerimiz hakkında herhangi bir şey öğrendiğinde onları alaya alır. Bunlar utanç verici bir azabı üzerlerine çekmişlerdir.

value: Awaiting them is Gehenna. Their earnings will not help them, nor the idols they had set up beside GOD. They have incurred a terrible retribution.
This is a beacon, and those who disbelieve in these revelations of their Lord have incurred condemnation and a painful retribution.
YENİSİ: Bu bir işaret ışığıdır, Rablerinin bu vahiylerini inkâr edenler kınanmayı ve acı veren bir azabı üzerlerine çekmişlerdir.

value: GOD is the One who committed the sea in your service, so that the ships can roam it in accordance with His laws. You thus seek His provisions, that you may be appreciative.
He committed in your service everything in the heavens and the earth; all from Him. These are proofs for people who reflect.
YENİSİ: O, göklerdeki ve yeryüzündeki her şeyi sizin hizmetinize verdi; tümü O’ndandır. Bunlar, derinlemesine düşünen halk için kanıtlardır.

value: Tell those who believed to forgive those who do not expect the days of GOD. He will fully pay everyone for whatever they have earned.

♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 45: Kneeling
(Al-Jãtheyah)
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
YENİSİ:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sure 45: Diz Çöküş
(El-Casiye)
En Lütufkâr ve En Merhametli Olan Tanrı’nın adıyla.

value: Which Hadith?*

*44:56 As detailed in Appendix 17, the righteous do not really die; they move on directly to the same Paradise where Adam and Eve once lived. Compare this statement with the disbelievers’ statement in 40:11.
*45:6-7 God condemns “Hadith” by name, and informs us that it is a blasphemous fabrication.
Kneeling (Al-Jãtheyah) 45:15-28
YENİSİ: Diz Çöküş (El-Casiye) 45:15-28

value: Whoever works righteousness does so for his own good, and whoever works evil does so to his own detriment. To your Lord you will be returned.
We have given the Children of Israel the scripture, wisdom, and prophethood, and provided them with good provisions; we bestowed upon them more blessings than any other people.

We have given them herein clear commandments. Ironically, they did not dispute this until the knowledge had come to them. This is due to jealousy on their part. Surely, your Lord will judge them on the Day of Resurrection regarding everything they have disputed.
YENİSİ: Onlara burada apaçık buyruklar verdik. İronik bir şekilde, onlara bilgi gelinceye kadar, onlar buna itiraz etmediler. Bu onlardaki kıskançlıktan kaynaklanmaktadır. Şüphesiz, senin Rabbin Diriliş Günü’nde ihtilafa düştükleri her şeye dair onları yargılayacaktır.

value: We then appointed you to establish the correct laws; you shall follow this, and do not follow the wishes of those who do not know.
They cannot help you at all against GOD. It is the transgressors who ally themselves with one another, while GOD is the Lord of the righteous.
This provides enlightenments for the people, and guidance, and mercy for those who are certain.
YENİSİ: Bu, insanlar için aydınlanmalar, rehberlik ve kesinliğe erişmiş olanlar için merhamet sağlar.

value: Do those who work evil expect that we will treat them in the same manner as those who believe and lead a righteous life? Can their life and their death be the same?* Wrong indeed is their judgment.
GOD created the heavens and the earth for a specific purpose, in order to pay each soul for whatever it earned, without the least injustice.*

Have you noted the one whose god is his ego? Consequently, GOD sends him astray, despite his knowledge, seals his hearing and his mind, and places a veil on his eyes. Who then can guide him, after such a decision by GOD? Would you not take heed?
YENİSİ: Kendi egosu tanrısı olan kişiye dikkat ettin mi? Bunun sonucunda, TANRI onu bilgisine rağmen saptırır, onun işitmesini ve zihnini mühürler ve gözlerinin üzerine bir perde yerleştirir. O zaman, TANRI’nın böyle bir kararından sonra ona kim rehberlik edebilir? Dikkate almayacak mısınız?

value: They said, “We only live this life; we live and die and only time causes our death!” They have no sure knowledge about this; they only conjecture.
YENİSİ: Dediler ki “Biz sadece bu hayatı yaşarız; yaşar ve ölürüz ve sadece zaman ölmemize sebep olur!” Onlar sadece zanda bulundukları bu konuda kesin bir bilgiye sahip değiller.

value: When our revelations are recited to them, clearly, their only argument is to say, “Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful.”
Say, “GOD has granted you life, then He puts you to death, then He will summon you to the Day of Resurrection, which is inevitable. But most people do not know.”
To GOD belongs all sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. The day the Hour (Judgment) comes to pass, that is when the falsifiers lose.
YENİSİ: Göklerin ve yeryüzünün bütün hükümranlığı TANRI’ya aittir. Saat'in (Yargı'nın) gerçekleştiği gün, işte o zaman sahtekârlar kaybeder.

value: You will see every community kneeling. Every community will be called to view their record. Today, you get paid for everything you have done.
YENİSİ: Her topluluğu diz çökmüş hâlde göreceksin. Her topluluk kendi kaydını görmesi için çağrılacaktır. Bugün, yapmış olduğunuz her şeyin karşılığı size ödenmektedir.

value: Common Form of Idolatry: The Ego As A god
Kneeling
*45:21 We now realize that the righteous do not really die—they go straight to Heaven (16:32)—while the unrighteous are beaten up by the angels of death (8:50 & 47:27).
*45:22 God granted us this life as a precious chance to redeem ourselves, denounce our ancient alliance with Satan, and rejoin God’s kingdom. See Introduction & Appendix 7.
YENİSİ: *45:22 Tanrı bize bu hayatı, kendimizi kurtarmamız, Şeytan’la olan çok eski ittifakımızı kınamamız ve Tanrı’nın krallığına tekrar girmemiz için değerli bir şans olarak verdi. Giriş’e ve Ek 7’ye bakınız.

value: Kneeling (Al-Jãtheyah) 45:29-37 & The Dunes (Al-Ahqãf) 46:1-7
YENİSİ: Diz Çöküş (El-Casiye) 45:29-37 & Kum Tepeleri (El-Ahkâf) 46:1-7

value: This is our record; it utters the truth about you. We have been recording everything you did.
As for those who believe and work righteousness, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. This is the great triumph.
As for those who disbelieve: “Were not My revelations recited to you, but you turned arrogant and were wicked people?”

When it is proclaimed that GOD’s promise is the truth and that the Hour (of Judgment) is inevitable, you said, “We do not know what the Hour is! We are full of conjecture about it; we are not certain.”
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın vaadinin gerçek olduğu ve (Yargı) Saati’nin kaçınılmaz olduğu ilan edildiğinde dediniz ki “Biz Saat’in ne olduğunu bilmeyiz! Bunun hakkında zanla doluyuz; emin değiliz.”

value: The evils of their works will become evident to them, and the very things they mocked will come back and haunt them.
It will be proclaimed: “Today we forget you, just as you forgot the meeting of this day. Your abode is the hellfire, and you will have no helpers.
“This is because you took GOD’s revelations in vain, and were preoccupied with the first life.” Consequently, they will never exit therefrom, nor will they be excused.
YENİSİ: “Bunun nedeni şudur: TANRI’nın vahiylerini hiçe saydınız ve zihniniz ilk hayatla meşgul oldu.” Sonuç olarak, onlar oradan asla çıkamayacaklar, mazur da görülmeyecekler.

value: To GOD belongs all praise; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of the universe.
To Him belongs all supremacy in the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, Most Wise.
H.M.
YENİSİ: H.M.

value: The revelation of this scripture is from GOD, the Almighty, Most Wise.

We did not create the heavens and the earth, and everything between them except for a specific purpose, and for a finite interim. Those who disbelieve are totally oblivious to the warnings given to them.
YENİSİ: Biz gökleri ve yeryüzünü ve aralarındaki her şeyi, spesifik bir amaç ve sonu olan bir geçici süre dışında yaratmadık. İnkâr edenler, kendilerine verilen uyarılara karşı tamamen gaflettedirler.

value: Say, “Consider the idols you have set up beside GOD. Show me what on earth did they create. Do they own part of the heavens? Show me any other scripture before this one, or any piece of established knowledge that supports your idolatry, if you are truthful.”
Who is farther astray than those who idolize beside GOD idols that can never respond to them until the Day of Resurrection, and are totally unaware of their worship?
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın yanında, Diriliş Günü’ne kadar kendilerine asla yanıt veremeyen ve onların tapınmalarından tamamen habersiz olan putlara tapanlardan daha fazla kim sapmıştır?

value: And when the people are summoned (on the Day of Judgment), their idols will become their enemies, and will denounce their idolatry.*
YENİSİ: Ve insanlar (Yargı Günü’nde) toplandığı zaman, putları kendilerinin düşmanları haline gelecek ve onların putperestliğini kınayacaklardır.*

value: When our revelations were recited to them, perfectly clear, those who disbelieved said of the truth that came to them, “This is obviously magic!”

♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sura 46: The Dunes
(Al-Ahqãf) 
In the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
YENİSİ:
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦
Sure 46: Kum Tepeleri
(El-Ahkâf) 
En Lütufkâr ve En Merhametli Olan Tanrı’nın adıyla.

value: The Idols Totally Unaware
The Idols Disown\nTheir Worshipers*
YENİSİ: Putlar Kendilerine Tapanları\nSahiplenmezler*

value: *46:6 See also Matthew 7:21-23: Jesus clearly disowns those who call him “Lord.”
YENİSİ: *46:6 Ayrıca Matta 7:21-23’e bakınız: İsa kendisini “Rab” olarak çağıranları açık bir biçimde sahiplenmeyecektir.

value: The Dunes (Al-Ahqãf) 46:8-18
YENİSİ: Kum Tepeleri (El-Ahkâf) 46:8-18

value: When they say, “He fabricated this,” say, “If I fabricated this, then you cannot protect me from GOD. He is fully aware of everything you scheme. He suffices as a witness between me and you. He is the Forgiver, Most Merciful.”
YENİSİ: Onlar “Bunu o uydurdu” dediklerinde, de ki: “Eğer bunu ben uydurduysam, o zaman siz beni TANRI’dan koruyamazsınız. O, planladığınız her şeyin tamamen farkındadır. Benimle sizin aranızda şahit olarak O yeter. O Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.”

value: Say, “I am not different from other messengers. I have no idea what will happen to me or to you. I only follow what is revealed to me. I am no more than a profound warner.”
YENİSİ: De ki: “Ben diğer elçilerden farklı değilim. Bana ya da size ne olacak hiçbir fikrim yok. Ben yalnızca bana vahyedileni takip ediyorum. Ben esaslı bir uyarıcıdan fazlası değilim.”

value: Say, “What if it is from GOD and you disbelieved in it? A witness from the Children of Israel has borne witness to a similar phenomenon,* and he has believed, while you have turned arrogant. Surely, GOD does not guide the wicked people.”

Those who disbelieved said about those who believed, “If it were anything good, they would not have accepted it before us.” Because they were not guided to it, they said, “This is an old fabrication!”
Before this, the book of Moses provided guidance and mercy. This too is a scripture that confirms, in Arabic, to warn those who transgressed, and to give good news to the righteous.
YENİSİ: Bundan önce, Musa’nın kitabı rehberlik ve merhamet sağladı. Bu da haddi aşanları uyarmak ve doğrulara müjde vermek için Arapça olan doğrulayıcı bir kutsal yazıdır.

value: Surely, those who say, “Our Lord is GOD,” then lead a righteous life, will have no fear, nor will they grieve.
They have deserved Paradise, where they abide forever; a reward for their works.

We enjoined the human being to honor his parents. His mother bore him arduously, gave birth to him arduously, and took intimate care of him for thirty months. When he reaches maturity, and reaches the age of forty,* he should say, “My Lord, direct me to appreciate the blessings You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do the righteous works that please You. Let my children be righteous as well. I have repented to You; I am a submitter.”
YENİSİ: Biz insana ebeveynlerine hürmet göstermesini tembih ettik. Annesi onu zahmetle taşıdı, zahmetle doğurdu ve otuz ay boyunca yakın bakımını üstlendi. O, olgunluğa erişince ve kırk yaşına* varınca şöyle söylemelidir, “Rabbim, beni, bana ve ebeveynlerime ihsan ettiğin nimetlere minnettar olmaya ve Seni memnun edecek olan doğru işleri yapmaya yönelt. Evlatlarım da doğru kimseler olsun. Ben Sana tövbe ettim; ben bir teslim olanım.”

value: It is from these that we accept the righteous works, and overlook their sins. They have deserved Paradise. This is the truthful promise that is promised to them.

Then there is the one who says to his parents, “Woe to you; are you telling me that (after death) I will come back to life? How come those who died before us never come back?” The parents would cry for GOD’s help and say, “Woe to you; please believe! GOD’s promise is the truth.” He would say, “Tales from the past!”
YENİSİ: Sonra öylesi de var ki, ebeveynlerine şunu der: “Yazık size; siz bana (ölümden sonra) hayata geri geleceğimi mi söylüyorsunuz? Nasıl olur da bizden önce ölenler hiç geri dönmüyorlar?” Ebeveynleri ise TANRI’nın yardımını isterken feryat eder ve derler ki: “Yazık sana; lütfen inan! TANRI’nın vaadi haktır.” O der ki: “Geçmişin masalları!”

value: Such are the ones stamped as disbelievers among every generation of jinns and humans; they are losers.
Rabbi Judah the Pious*
YENİSİ: Tahva Ehli Haham Yahuda*

value: Good News
40: The Age of Decision*
*46:10 This witness is Rabbi Judah the Pious (11th Century A.D.), who discovered the same 19-based mathematical code in intact fragments of the scripture (see Appendix 1).
YENİSİ: *46:10 Bu şahit, aynı 19-tabanlı matematiksel kodu kutsal yazıların bozulmamış parçalarında keşfeden Takva ehli Haham Yahuda’dır (M.S. 11. Yüzyıl) (Ek 1’e bakınız).

value: *46:15 God knows full well who deserves to go to Heaven and who deserves to go to Hell. It is His law that whomever He puts to death before the age of 40 shall go to Heaven. God’s immense mercy is reflected in the fact that most people have difficulty accepting this divine mercy; they argue: “Put them in Hell!” See Appendix 32.
YENİSİ: *46:15 Tanrı, kimin Cennete gitmeyi hak ettiğini ve kimin Cehenneme gitmeyi hak ettiğini tam olarak bilir. Bu O’nun bir yasasıdır ki O, kimi 40 yaşından önce ölüme koyarsa o kişi Cennete gidecektir. Tanrı’nın engin merhameti, çoğu insanın bu göksel merhameti kabul etmekte zorluk yaşadığı gerçeğinde yansımaktadır; şöyle karşı gelirler: “Onları Cehenneme koy!” Ek 32’ye bakınız.
qx

value: The Dunes (Al-Ahqãf) 46:19-31
YENİSİ: Kum Tepeleri (El-Ahkâf) 46:19-31

value: They all attain the ranks they have deserved, in accordance with their works. He will pay them for their works, without the least injustice.

The day will come when those who disbelieved will be introduced to the hellfire: “You have wasted the good chances given to you during your worldly life, and you rejoiced in them. Consequently, today you incur a shameful retribution as a requital for the arrogance you committed on earth without any basis, and for your evil works.”
YENİSİ: İnkâr etmiş olanların cehennem ateşine sunulacakları gün gelecek: “Dünyevi hayatınız boyunca size verilmiş güzel fırsatları boşa harcadınız ve onlardan zevk aldınız. Sonuç olarak, bugün, hiçbir dayanağınız olmadan yeryüzünde küstahça büyüklük taslamanızın ve kötü işlerinizin bir karşılığı olarak utanç verici bir azabı üzerinize çekiyorsunuz.”

value: Recall that the brother of ‘Ãd warned his people at the dunes— numerous warnings were also delivered before him and after him: “You shall not worship except GOD. I fear for you the retribution of a great day.”
They said, “Did you come to divert us from our gods? We challenge you to bring (the retribution) you threaten, if you are truthful.”
He said, “The knowledge about this is with GOD; I only deliver to you what I was sent to deliver. However, I see that you people are ignorant.”

When they saw the storm heading their way, they said, “This storm will bring to us much needed rain.” Instead, this is what you challenged (Hûd) to bring; violent wind wherein there is painful retribution.
It destroyed everything, as commanded by its Lord. By morning, nothing was standing except their homes. We thus requite the guilty people.
YENİSİ: Her şeyi işe yaramaz hâle getirdi, Rabbi tarafından emredildiği gibi. Sabahında, evleri dışında hiçbir şey ayakta durmuyordu. Biz suçlu insanlara böyle karşılık veririz.

value: We had established them in the same way as we established you, and provided them with hearing, eyes, and minds. But their hearing, eyes, and minds did not help them at all. This is because they decided to disregard GOD’s revelations. Thus, the prophecies and warnings that they ridiculed have caused their doom.
YENİSİ: Sizi yerleştirdiğimiz gibi aynı yöntemle onları da yerleştirmiştik ve onlara işitme, gözler ve zihinler sağlamıştık. Fakat onların işitmesi, gözleri ve zihinleri onlara hiçbir şekilde yardım etmedi. Bunun nedeni onların TANRI’nın vahiylerini göz ardı etmeye karar vermeleriydi. Böylece, alay ettikleri kehanetler ve uyarılar onların mahvoluşuna yol açmıştır.

value: We have annihilated many communities around you, after we had explained the proofs, that they might repent.
YENİSİ: Biz, tövbe edebilsinler diye kanıtları açıklamış olduktan sonra, çevrenizdeki birçok topluluğu imha ettik.

value: Why then did the idols they set up to bring them closer to GOD fail to help them? Instead, they abandoned them. Such were the false gods they idolized; such were the innovations they fabricated.
YENİSİ: O zaman neden kendilerini TANRI’ya yaklaştırsınlar diye edindikleri putlar onlara yardım edemedi? Tam tersi, onları terk ettiler. İşte putlaştırdıkları sahte tanrılar böyleydi; işte uydurdukları bid'atler böyleydi.

value: Recall that we directed a number of jinns to you, in order to let them hear the Quran. When they got there, they said, “Listen.” As soon as it was over, they rushed to their people, warning.*
They said, “O our people, we have heard a book that was revealed after Moses, and confirms the previous scriptures. It guides to the truth; to the right path.
YENİSİ: Dediler ki: “Ey halkımız, biz Musa’dan sonra vahyedilen ve önceki kutsal yazıları doğrulayan bir kitap işittik. O, hakikate; doğru yola yönlendiriyor.

value: “O our people, respond to the call of GOD, and believe in Him. He will then forgive your sins, and spare you a painful retribution.”
YENİSİ: “Ey halkımız, TANRI’nın çağrısına yanıt verin ve O’na inanın. O zaman günahlarınızı bağışlayacak ve sizi acı veren bir azaptan koruyacaktır.”

value: Hûd
YENİSİ: Hûd

value: They Ridiculed the\nMessenger’s Warnings
Believers Among the Jinns*

*46:29 Jinns are the creatures who fully agreed with Satan when he initiated his famous blasphemy billions of years ago. They are brought into this world as descendants of Satan. One jinn is born every time a human being is born. The newly born jinn is assigned to the same body as the newly born human, and constantly pushes Satan’s point of view (Appendix 7).
YENİSİ: *46:29 Cinler, milyarlarca yıl önce Şeytan ünlü küfrünü başlattığında onunla tamamen hemfikir olan yaratıklardır. Onlar bu dünyaya Şeytan’ın soyu olarak getirilirler. Ne zaman bir insan doğsa, bir de cin doğar. Yeni doğan cin, yeni doğan insanla aynı bedene atanır ve sürekli olarak Şeytan’ın bakış açısını dayatır (Ek 7).

value: The Dunes (Al-Ahqãf) 46:32-35 & Muhammad 47:1-11
YENİSİ: Kum Tepeleri (El-Ahkâf) 46:32-35 & Muhammed 47:1-11

value: Those who fail to respond to GOD’s call cannot escape, and will have no Lord other than Him; they have gone far astray.
YENİSİ: TANRI’nın çağrısına yanıt veremeyenler kaçıp kurtulamazlar ve O’ndan başka Rableri olmayacaktır; onlar derinlemesine sapmıştır.

value: Do they not realize that GOD, who created the heavens and the earth without the least effort is able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Omnipotent.

The day the disbelievers are introduced to the Hellfire, they will be asked, “Is this not the truth?” They will answer, “Yes indeed, by our Lord.” He will say, “Then suffer the retribution for your disbelief.”

Therefore, be patient like the messengers before you who possessed strength and resorted to patience. Do not be in a hurry to see the retribution that will inevitably come to them. The day they see it, it will seem as if they lasted one hour of the day. This is a proclamation: Is it not the wicked who are consistently annihilated?
YENİSİ: Bu nedenle, senden önce güç sahibi olan ve sabra başvuran elçiler gibi sen de sabırlı ol. Onlara kaçınılmaz bir şekilde gelecek olan azabı görmek için acele etme. Onu gördükleri gün, onlara sanki günün bir saati kadar kalmışlar gibi gelecek. Bu bir ilandır: daima imha edilenler kötüler değil midir?

value: God’s Messenger of the Covenant*
YENİSİ: Tanrı’nın Antlaşma Elçisi*

value: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, He nullifies their works.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler ve TANRI’nın yolundan uzaklaştıranlar; O onların işlerini geçersiz kılar.

value: Those who believe and work righteousness, and believe in what was sent down to Muhammad—which is the truth from their Lord—He remits their sins, and blesses them with contentment.
YENİSİ: İnanan ve doğruluğa çalışanlar ve Muhammed’e indirilene—ki o Rablerinden gelen hakikattir—inananlar, O onların günahlarını örter ve onları gönül ferahlığı ile nimetlendirir.

value: This is because those who disbelieve are following falsehood, while those who believe are following the truth from their Lord. GOD thus cites for the people, their examples.
YENİSİ: Bunun nedeni inkâr edenlerin yalanı takip ediyor olmaları, inananların ise Rablerinden gelen hakikati takip ediyor olmalarıdır. TANRI böylece insanlara onların örneklerini verir.

value: If you encounter (in war) those who disbelieve, you may strike the necks. If you take them as captives you may set them free or ransom them, until the war ends. Had GOD willed, He could have granted you victory, without war. But He thus tests you by one another. As for those who get killed in the cause of GOD, He will never put their sacrifice to waste.
He will guide them, and bless them with contentment.
He will admit them into Paradise, that He described to them.
O you who believe, if you support GOD, He will support you, and strengthen your foothold.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, eğer TANRI’yı desteklerseniz, O sizi destekleyecek ve ayaklarınızı sağlamlaştıracaktır.

value: Those who disbelieve incur misery; He causes their works to be utterly in vain.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler sefaleti üzerlerine çekerler; O onların işlerinin tümüyle boşa gitmesine yol açar.

value: That is because they hated what GOD revealed and consequently, He nullifies their works.
Did they not roam the earth and see the consequences for those before them? GOD destroyed their works; all disbelievers will suffer the same fate.
This is because GOD is the Lord of those who believe, while the disbelievers have no lord.
♦ ♦ ♦ ♦\nSura 47: Muhammad\nIn the name of God, Most Gracious, Most Merciful
YENİSİ: ♦ ♦ ♦ ♦\nSure 47: Muhammed\nEn Lütufkâr ve En Merhametli Olan Tanrı’nın adıyla.

value: *46:35 Quranic and mathematical evidence proves that the messenger addressed here is Rashad Khalifa. By adding the gematrical value of “Rashad Khalifa” (1230), plus the sura number (46), plus the verse number (35), we get 1311, or 19x69. This conforms with the Quran’s code (Appendix 2).
Muhammad 47:12-23
YENİSİ: Muhammed 47:12-23

value: GOD admits those who believe and lead a righteous life into gardens with flowing streams. As for those who disbelieve, they live and eat like the animals eat, then end up in the hellfire.
YENİSİ: TANRI, inanıp doğru bir hayat sürenleri akan nehirleri olan bahçelere kabul eder. İnkâr edenlere gelince, onlar hayvanların yediği gibi yiyip yaşarlar, sonra da cehennem ateşini boylarlar.

value: Many a community was much stronger than the community that evicted you from your town; when we annihilated them, no one could help them.
YENİSİ: Birçok topluluk, kendi beldenden seni çıkaran topluluktan çok daha güçlüydü; onları imha ettiğimiz zaman, hiç kimse onlara yardım edemedi.

value: Are those enlightened by their Lord the same as those whose evil works are adorned in their eyes, and they follow their own opinions?
YENİSİ: Rableri tarafından aydınlananlar ile kötü işleri gözlerinde süslenenler ve kendi görüşlerini takip edenler aynı mıdır?

value: The allegory of Paradise that is promised for the righteous is this: it has rivers of unpolluted water, and rivers of fresh milk, and rivers of wine—delicious for the drinkers— and rivers of strained honey. They have all kinds of fruits therein, and forgiveness from their Lord. (Are they better) or those who abide forever in the hellfire, and drink hellish water that tears up their intestines?
Some of them listen to you, then as soon as they leave they ask those who were enlightened, “What did he just say?” GOD thus seals their hearts and, consequently, they follow only their opinions.
YENİSİ: Onlardan bazıları seni dinler, sonra ayrılır ayrılmaz aydınlatılmış olanlara sorarlar, “Az önce ne dedi o?” TANRI böylece onların kalplerini mühürler ve sonuç olarak onlar yalnızca kendi görüşlerini takip ederler.

value: As for those who are guided, He augments their guidance, and grants them their righteousness.
YENİSİ: Rehberlik edilenlere gelince, O onların hidayetini artırır ve onlara doğruluklarını bahşeder.

value: Are they waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? All the signs thereof have already come.* Once the Hour comes to them, how will they benefit from their message?
You shall know that: “There is no other god beside GOD,”* and ask forgiveness of your sins and the sins of all believing men and women. GOD is fully aware of your decisions and your ultimate destiny.

Those who believed said: “When will a new sura be revealed?” But when a straightforward sura was revealed, wherein fighting was mentioned, you would see those who harbored doubts in their hearts looking at you, as if death had already come to them. They were thus exposed.
Obedience and righteous utterances are expected of them. If only they showed confidence in GOD, when mobilization was called for, it would have been better for them.
Is it also your intention that as soon as you leave you will commit evil and mistreat your relatives?
It is those who incurred a curse from GOD, whereby He rendered them deaf and blind.
End of the World*
Lã Elãha Ellã Allãh:\nFirst Commandment
Exposing the Hypocrites
Proof of Faith During\nMuhammad’s Era
*47:18 The Quran, being the Final Testament, provides all the signs needed to pinpoint the end of the world; AD 2280. See Appendix 25 for the details.
*47:19 Significantly, the “First Pillar” of religion is stated in the sura entitled Muhammad, and is utterly devoted to God alone. Muhammad’s name was added by his idolizers, against his will.
YENİSİ: *47:19 Dinin “İlk Şartı” önemle vurgulanarak Muhammed başlıklı surede belirtilmiş ve mutlak bir şekilde yalnızca Tanrı’ya adanmıştır. Muhammed’in adı, onun isteği dışında onu putlaştıranlar tarafından eklendi.

value: Muhammad 47:24-38
YENİSİ: Muhammed 47:24-38

value: Why do they not study the Quran carefully? Do they have locks on their minds?
YENİSİ: Neden Kuran’ı dikkatlice incelemiyorlar? Zihinleri üzerinde kilitler mi var?

value: Surely, those who slide back, after the guidance has been manifested to them, the devil has enticed them and led them on.
YENİSİ: Şüphesiz, kılavuz kendilerine açıkça gösterildikten sonra geriye kayanlar, şeytan onları ayartmış ve onları peşinden sürüklemiştir.

value: This is because they said to those who hated what GOD has sent down, “We will obey you in certain matters.” GOD fully knows their secret conspiracies.
How will it be for them when the angels put them to death? They will beat them on their faces and their rear ends.
This is because they followed what angered GOD and hated the things that please Him. Consequently, He has nullified their works.
Did those who harbor doubts in their hearts think that GOD will not bring out their evil thoughts?
YENİSİ: Kalplerinde şüpheler barındıranlar, TANRI’nın onların kötü düşüncelerini ortaya çıkarmayacağını mı sandılar?

value: If we will, we can expose them for you, so that you can recognize them just by looking at them. However, you can recognize them by the way they talk. GOD is fully aware of all your works.
We will certainly put you to the test, in order to distinguish those among you who strive, and steadfastly persevere. We must expose your true qualities.
Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, and oppose the messenger after the guidance has been manifested for them, will never hurt GOD in the least. Instead, He nullifies their works.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler ve TANRI’nın yolundan uzaklaştıranlar ve kılavuz onlar için açıkça ortaya konduktan sonra elçiye muhalefet edenler, TANRI’ya asla en ufak zarar veremezler. Aksine, O onların işlerini boşa çıkarır.

value: O you who believe, you shall obey GOD, and obey the messenger. Otherwise, all your works will be in vain.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, TANRI’ya itaat edin, ve elçiye itaat edin. Aksi taktirde, bütün işleriniz boşa gidecektir.

value: Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of GOD, then die as disbelievers, GOD will never forgive them.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler ve TANRI’nın yolundan uzaklaştıranlar, sonra da inkârcı olarak ölenler; TANRI onları asla bağışlamayacaktır.

value: Therefore, you shall not waver and surrender in pursuit of peace, for you are guaranteed victory, and GOD is with you. He will never waste your efforts.
YENİSİ: Bu nedenle, barışın peşinde tereddüt edip pes etmeyin, zira galibiyet size garanti edilmiştir ve TANRI sizinle beraberdir. O, çabalarınızı asla zayi etmeyecektir.

value: This worldly life is no more than play and vanity. But if you believe and lead a righteous life, He will reward you, without asking you for any money.
YENİSİ: Bu dünyevi hayat bir oyun ve gösterişten fazlası değildir. Fakat eğer inanır ve doğru bir hayat sürerseniz, O sizden hiçbir para istemeksizin sizi ödüllendirecektir.

value: If He asked you for money, to the extent of creating a hardship for you, you might have become stingy, and your hidden evil might be exposed.

You are invited to spend in the cause of GOD, but some of you turn stingy. The stingy are stingy towards their own souls. GOD is Rich, while you are poor.

Warning to the Arabs*
If you turn away, He will substitute other people in your place, and they will not be like you.
Study the Quran
The Great Disaster
*47:38 The Quran was given to the Arabs, in their language, for 1400 years, but they clearly rejected it and refused to believe that it is complete; they fabricated Hadith & Sunna.
Victory (Al-Fatt-h) 48:1-13
YENİSİ: Galibiyet (El-Fetih) 48:1-13

value: We have bestowed upon you (O Messenger) a great victory.*
Whereby GOD forgives your past sins, as well as future sins, and perfects His blessings upon you, and guides you in a straight path.
Additionally, GOD will support you with an unwavering support.

He is the One who places contentment into the hearts of believers to augment more faith, in addition to their faith. To GOD belongs all forces of the heavens and the earth. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
He will certainly admit the believing men and women into gardens with flowing streams, wherein they abide forever. He will remit their sins. This is, in the sight of GOD, a great triumph.
YENİSİ: O, kesinlikle inanan erkek ve kadınları içinde sonsuza kadar kalacakları, akan nehirleri olan bahçelere kabul edecektir. Onların günahlarını örtecektir. Bu, TANRI nezdinde büyük bir zaferdir.

value: And He will requite the hypocrite men and women and the idol worshiping men and women, for they have harbored evil thoughts about GOD. Their evil will backfire against them. For GOD is angry with them, condemns them, and has prepared for them Gehenna. What a miserable destiny!
YENİSİ: Ve O, ikiyüzlü erkek ve kadınlara ve putperest erkek ve kadınlara karşılık verecektir, zira onlar TANRI hakkında kötü düşünceler beslediler. Kötülükleri onların aleyhinde geri tepecektir. Zira TANRI onlara kızgındır, onları kınamaktadır ve onlar için Cehennemi hazırlamıştır. Ne sefil bir kader!

value: To GOD belongs all the forces in the heavens and the earth. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.
We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news, and a warner.
YENİSİ: Biz seni bir şahit, bir müjdeleyici ve bir uyarıcı olarak gönderdik.

value: That you people may believe in GOD and His messenger, and reverence Him, and observe Him, and glorify Him, day and night.

Surely, those who pledge allegiance to you, are pledging allegiance to GOD. GOD approves their pledge; He places His hand above their hands. Those who violate such a pledge, commit the violation to their own detriment. As for those who fulfill their pledge with GOD, He will grant them a great recompense.

The sedentary Arabs who stay behind will say, “We have been preoccupied with our money and our families, so ask forgiveness for us!” They utter with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Who can protect you from GOD, if He willed any adversity for you, or if He willed any blessing for you?” GOD is fully Cognizant of everything you do.
YENİSİ: Geride kalan yerinden kımıldamayan Araplar diyecekler ki: “Zihinlerimiz paramızla ve ailelerimizle meşgul oldu, bu yüzden bizim için bağışlanma dile!” Onlar kalplerinde olmayanı dilleri ile söylerler. De ki: “Eğer O, sizin için herhangi bir sıkıntı irade etmiş olsa veya O, sizin için herhangi bir nimet irade etmiş olsa, sizi TANRI’dan kim koruyabilir?” TANRI yaptığınız her şeyden tamamen Haberdardır.

value: You secretly believed that the messenger and the believers will be defeated and never come back to their families, and this was firmly established in your hearts. You harbored evil thoughts and turned into wicked people.
Anyone who refuses to believe in GOD and His messenger, we have prepared for the disbelievers a hellfire.

value: You Shall Support\nGod’s Messenger

*48:1 This profound statement consists of 19 letters, indicating that our generation is the generation of victory for God’s purified, unified, and consolidated religion—Submission (3:19, 3:85). It is our generation that witnessed the revelations of God’s great miracle in the Quran (Appendix 1).
Victory (Al-Fatt-h) 48:14-25
YENİSİ: Galibiyet (El-Fetih) 48:14-25

value: To GOD belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whomever He wills, and punishes whomever He wills. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Göklerin ve yeryüzünün hükümranlığı TANRI’ya aittir. O, irade ettiği kimseyi bağışlar ve irade ettiği kimseyi cezalandırır. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: The sedentary who stay behind will say, when you are expected to collect spoils of war, “Let us follow you to share in this!” They thus wish to alter GOD’s words. Say, “You will not follow us. This is GOD’s decision.” They will then say, “You must be envious of us (for staying behind).” Indeed, they rarely understood anything.
YENİSİ: Geride kalan yerinden kımıldamayanlar, sizden savaş ganimetlerini toplamanız beklendiğinde şöyle diyecekler: “Bırakın da bunda pay almak için biz de sizi takip edelim!” Böylece TANRI’nın sözlerini değiştirmek isterler. De ki: “Bizi takip etmeyeceksiniz. Bu, TANRI’nın kararıdır.” O zaman da diyecekler ki: “Siz bizi (geride kaldığımız için) kıskanıyor olmalısınız.” Gerçekten de, onlar herhangi bir şeyi nadiren anladılar.

value: Say to the sedentary Arabs who stay behind, “You will be invited to face powerful people and to fight them, unless they submit. If you obey, GOD will reward you with a generous recompense. But if you turn away again, as you did in the past, He will requite you with a painful retribution.”
YENİSİ: Geride kalan yerinden kımıldamayan Araplara de ki: “Sizler güçlü bir halkla yüz yüze gelmeye ve onlar teslim olmadıkça savaşmaya davet edileceksiniz. Eğer itaat ederseniz, TANRI sizi cömert bir mükâfat ile ödüllendirecektir. Fakat eğer geçmişte yaptığınız gibi tekrar yüz çevirirseniz, O acı veren bir azapla size karşılığını verecektir.”

value: The blind is not to be blamed, the crippled is not to be blamed, and the sick is not to be blamed. Those who obey GOD and His messenger, He will admit them into gardens with flowing streams. As for those who turn away, He will requite them with a painful retribution.
YENİSİ: Kör olan sorumlu tutulmaz, sakat olan sorumlu tutulmaz ve hasta olan da sorumlu tutulmaz. TANRI’ya ve elçisine itaat edenleri, O akan nehirleri olan bahçelere kabul edecektir. Yüz çevirenlere gelince, O acı veren bir azapla onlara karşılığını verecektir.

value: GOD is pleased with the believers who pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts and, consequently, He blessed them with contentment, and rewarded them with an immediate victory.
Additionally, they gained many spoils. GOD is Almighty, Most Wise.

GOD has promised you many spoils that you will gain. He thus advanced some benefits for you in this life, and He has withheld the people’s hands of aggression against you, and has rendered this a sign for the believers. He thus guides you in a straight path.
YENİSİ: TANRI size elde edeceğiniz nice ganimetler vadetti. O böylece bu hayatta bazı faydaları sizin için erken verdi, insanların size saldırmak için uzanan ellerini geri çekti ve bunu da inananlar için bir işaret kıldı. O böylece size dosdoğru bir yolda rehberlik eder.

value: As for the group that you could not possibly defeat, GOD took care of them; GOD is Omnipotent.
If the disbelievers ever fought you, they would turn around and flee. They have no Lord and Master; they have no helper.
Such is GOD’s system throughout history, and you will find that GOD’s system is unchangeable.

He is the One who withheld their hands of aggression against you, and withheld your hands of aggression against them in the valley of Mecca, after He had granted you victory over them. GOD is Seer of everything you do.
YENİSİ: Size onlar üzerinde galibiyet bahşettikten sonra, Mekke vadisinde, onların size saldırmak için uzanan ellerini geri çeken de sizin onlara saldırmak için uzanan ellerinizi geri çeken de O’dur. TANRI yaptığınız her şeyi Görendir.

value: It is they who disbelieved and barred you from the Sacred Masjid, and even prevented your offerings from reaching their destination. There were believing men and women (within the enemy camp) whom you did not know, and you were about to hurt them, unknowingly. GOD thus admits into His mercy whomever He wills. If they persist, He will requite those among them who disbelieve with a painful retribution.
YENİSİ: İnkâr eden, sizi Kutsal Mescitten alıkoyan ve kurbanlarınızın varış noktasına ulaşmasını bile engelleyen onlardır. (Düşman kampında bulunduğunu) bilmediğiniz inanan erkek ve kadınlar vardı ve bilmeyerek onlara zarar vermek üzereydiniz. TANRI böylece kimi irade ederse onu merhametine kabul eder. Eğer diretirlerse, O onların arasındaki inkârcılara acı veren bir azapla karşılığını verecektir.

value: The Test for Early Generations
YENİSİ: İlk Nesiller İçin Test

value: Victory\nGuaranteed\nfor the Believers

value: Victory (Al-Fatt-h) 48:26-29 & The Walls (Al-Hujurãt) 49:1-3
YENİSİ: Galibiyet (El-Fetih) 48:26-29 & Duvarlar (El-Hucurat) 49:1-3

value: While those who disbelieved were enraged, and their hearts were filled with the pride of the days of ignorance, GOD blessed His messenger and the believers with peaceful contentment, and directed them to uphold the word of righteousness. This is what they well deserved. GOD is fully aware of all things.
YENİSİ: İnkâr edenler öfkeli ve onların kalpleri cahiliye günlerinin kibri ile dolu olduğu hâlde, TANRI, elçisini ve inananları gönül ferahlığı ile nimetlendirdi ve onları doğruluk kelamına bağlı kalmaya yönlendirdi. Bu, onların layıkıyla hak ettkileri şeydi. TANRI her şeyin tamamen farkındadır.

value: GOD has fulfilled His messenger’s truthful vision: “You will enter the Sacred Masjid, GOD willing, perfectly secure, and you will cut your hair or shorten it (as you fulfill the pilgrimage rituals) there. You will not have any fear. Since He knew what you did not know, He has coupled this with an immediate victory.”
He is the One who sent His messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all other religions. GOD suffices as a witness.*
YENİSİ: Elçisini kılavuz ve hakikat dini ile gönderen O’dur; onu diğer tüm dinlere üstün kılmak için. Bir şahit olarak TANRI yeter.*

value: Muhammad—the messenger of GOD—and those with him are harsh and stern against the disbelievers, but kind and compassionate amongst themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, as they seek GOD blessings and approval. Their marks are on their faces, because of prostrating. This is the same example as in the Torah. Their example in the Gospel is like plants that grow taller and stronger, and please the farmers. He thus enrages the disbelievers. GOD promises those among them who believe and lead a righteous life forgiveness and a great recompense.
YENİSİ: Muhammed—TANRI’nın elçisi—ve onunla birlikte olanlar, inkârcılara karşı sert ve amansızdırlar, fakat kendi aralarında nazik ve şefkatlidirler. Onları, TANRI’nın nimetlerini ve onayını ararken rükû ve secde ediyor hâlde görürsün. Secde etmenin sayesinde onların işaretleri yüzlerindedir. Bu, Tevrat’taki örneğin aynısıdır. Onların İncil’deki örnekleri ise boy atıp güçlenen ve çiftçileri hoşnut eden bitkilere benzer. O, böylece inkârcıları öfkelendirir. TANRI, aralarından inanan ve doğru bir hayat sürenlere bağışlanma ve büyük bir mükâfat vadeder.

value: The Great Prophecy*
Qualities of the Believers
YENİSİ: İnananların Nitelikleri

value: O you who believe, do not place your opinion above that of GOD and His messenger. You shall reverence GOD. GOD is Hearer, Omniscient.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, kendi görüşünüzü TANRI’nın ve elçisininkinin üzerine geçirmeyin. TANRI’ya derin saygı duyun. TANRI İşitendir, Her Şeyi Bilendir.

value: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet,* nor shall you shout at him as you shout at each other, lest your works become nullified while you do not perceive.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, sesinizi peygamberin* sesinin üzerine yükseltmeyin, birbirinize bağırdığınız gibi de ona bağırmayın, yoksa siz farkına varmadan işleriniz boşa çıkar.

value: Surely, those who lower their voices at the messenger of GOD are the ones whose hearts are prepared by GOD to become righteous.* They have deserved forgiveness and a great recompense.
YENİSİ: Şüphesiz, TANRI'nın elçisinin yanında seslerini alçaltanlar TANRI tarafından kalpleri doğru olmaya hazırlanmış kimselerdir.* Onlar bağışlanmayı ve büyük bir mükafatı hak etmişlerdir.

value: *48:28 This important prophecy informs us that Submission will inevitably dominate the whole world. This, together with Verses 9:33, 41:53, and 61:9 leave no doubt that God’s mathematical miracle of the Quran will play a major role in this prophecy. Solid Quranic mathematical evidence points to God’s Messenger of the Covenant as fulfilling this prophecy. See Appendices 2 & 26 for the evidence and specific details.
YENİSİ: *48:28 Bu önemli kehanet, Teslimiyet'in kaçınılmaz olarak tüm dünyaya hâkim olacağını bize bildirir. Bu, 9:33, 41:53 ve 61:9 ayetleriyle birlikte, Tanrı'nın Kuran'daki matematiksel mucizesinin bu kehanette büyük rol oynayacağına dair hiçbir şüphe bırakmaz. Sağlam Kuranî matematiksel delil, bu kehaneti yerine getirerek Tanrı'nın Antlaşma Elçisi'ne işaret etmektedir. Delil ve ayrıntılar için Ek 2 ve 26'ya bakınız.

value: *49:2 Whenever the word “prophet” (Nabi) is used in reference to Muhammad, it invariably refers to him during his life, not after his death. Obviously, we cannot possibly raise our voices above Muhammad’s voice, now that he is dead. See also 33:56.
YENİSİ: *49:2 “Peygamber” (Nebi) kelimesi her ne zaman Muhammed’e referans olarak kullanıldığında onun hayatta olduğu döneme atıfta bulunur; ölümünden sonrasına değil. Açıkçası, madem ki o ölü; sesimizi Muhammed’in sesinin üzerine yükseltmemiz mümkün değildir. Ayrıca bkz. 33:56.

value: *49:3 Respecting the messenger helps outsiders and visitors in coming to God’s message.
YENİSİ: *49:3 Elçiye saygı göstermek, sizden olmayanların ve ziyaretçilerin Tanrı'nın mesajına ulaşmalarına yardımcı olur.

value: The Walls (Al-Hujurãt) 49:4-14
YENİSİ: Duvarlar (El-Hucurat) 49:4-14

value: As for those who call on you from outside the walls, most of them do not understand.
YENİSİ: Duvarların dışından sana seslenenlere gelince, onların çoğu anlamaz.

value: Had they been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Sen onların karşısına çıkana kadar sabırlı olmuş olsalardı, onlar için daha iyi olurdu. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: O you who believe, if a wicked person brings any news to you, you shall first investigate, lest you commit injustice towards some people, out of ignorance, then become sorry and remorseful for what you have done.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, eğer kötü bir kişi size herhangi bir haber getirirse öncelikle araştırın, yoksa cahillikten bazı insanlara haksızlık edersiniz, sonra da yapmış olduğunuza üzgün ve pişman olursunuz.

value: And know that GOD’s messenger has come in your midst. Had he listened to you in many things, you would have made things difficult for yourselves. But GOD made you love faith and adorned it in your hearts, and He made you abhor disbelief, wickedness, and disobedience. These are the guided ones.
YENİSİ: Ve bilin ki TANRI’nın elçisi aranıza gelmiş bulunuyor. Birçok konuda sizi dinlemiş olsaydı, kendiniz için işleri zorlaştırmış olacaktınız. Fakat TANRI size imanı sevdirdi ve onu kalplerinizde süsledi ve O sizin inkârdan, kötülükten ve itaatsizlikten iğrenmenizi sağladı. Bunlar hidayete ermiş kimselerdir.

value: Such is grace from GOD and His blessings. GOD is Omniscient, Most Wise.
YENİSİ: İşte bu, TANRI'dan lütuf ve O'nun nimetleridir. TANRI Her Şeyi Bilen, En Bilge Olandır.

value: If two groups of believers fought with each other, you shall reconcile them. If one group aggresses against the other, you shall fight the aggressing group until they submit to GOD’s command. Once they submit, you shall reconcile the two groups equitably. You shall maintain justice; GOD loves those who are just.
YENİSİ: Eğer inanan iki grup birbirleriyle savaşırsa, onları uzlaştırın. Bir grup diğerine saldırırsa, saldıran grup Allah'ın emrine boyun eğene kadar onlarla savaşacaksınız. Boyun eğdikten sonra, iki grubu adil bir şekilde barıştıracaksınız. Adaleti koruyacaksınız; Allah adil olanları sever.

value: The believers are members of one family; you shall keep the peace within your family and reverence GOD, that you may attain mercy.
YENİSİ: İnananlar tek bir ailenin fertleridir; ailenizde barışı muhafaza edin ve TANRI’ya derin saygı duyun ki merhamete erişesiniz.

value: O you who believe, no people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you mock one another, or make fun of your names. Evil indeed is the reversion to wickedness after attaining faith. Anyone who does not repent after this, these are the transgressors.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, hiçbir halk başka bir halkla dalga geçmesin, çünkü onlar kendilerinden daha iyi olabilirler. Hiçbir kadın da başka bir kadınla dalga geçmesin, çünkü onlar kendilerinden daha iyi olabilirler. Birbirinizle alay da etmeyin veya birbirinizin isimlerini eğlence konusu da yapmayın. İmana eriştikten sonra kötülüğe geri dönüş gerçekten de çok kötüdür. Kim bundan sonra tövbe etmezse, işte bunlar haddi aşanlardır.

value: O you who believe, you shall avoid any suspicion, for even a little bit of suspicion is sinful. You shall not spy on one another, nor shall you backbite one another; this is as abominable as eating the flesh of your dead brother. You certainly abhor this. You shall observe GOD. GOD is Redeemer, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Ey inananlar, herhangi bir suizandan kaçının, zira suizanın çok azı bile günahtır. Birbirinizin casusluğunu yapmayın, birbirinizi arkadan çekiştirmeyin de; bu, ölmüş kardeşinizin etini yemek kadar iğrençtir. Siz bundan kesinlikle iğrenirsiniz. TANRI’yı gözetin. TANRI Kurtarıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: O people, we created you from the same male and female, and rendered you distinct peoples and tribes, that you may recognize one another. The best among you in the sight of GOD is the most righteous. GOD is Omniscient, Cognizant.
YENİSİ: Ey insanlar, sizi aynı erkek ve dişiden yarattık ve sizi farklı milletler ve kabileler kıldık ki  birbirinizi tanıyasınız. TANRI nezdinde içinizden en iyiniz, en doğru olandır. TANRI Her Şeyi Bilendir, Haberdardır.

value: The Arabs said, “We are Mu’mens (believers).” Say, “You have not believed; what you should say is, ‘We are Muslims (submitters),’ until belief is established in your hearts.” If you obey GOD and His messenger, He will not put any of your works to waste. GOD is Forgiver, Most Merciful.
YENİSİ: Araplar dediler ki: “Biz Mu’minleriz (inananlarız).” De ki: “Siz inanmış değilsiniz; inanç kalplerinizde yerleşinceye kadar söylemeniz gereken şudur: ‘Biz Müslümanlarız (teslim olanlarız).’ ” Eğer TANRI’ya ve elçisine itaat ederseniz, O, işlerinizin hiçbirini heba etmeyecektir. TANRI Bağışlayıcıdır, En Merhametli Olandır.

value: Investigate Rumors Before\nBelieving Them
Reconcile The Believers
The Real Family
YENİSİ: Asıl Aile

value: Believers Set the Example
YENİSİ: İnananlar Örnek Olurlar

value: Suspicion Is Sinful
YENİSİ: Suizan Günahtır

Muslim vs. Mu’men
